My family's room was in slightly better shape. For some reason, my in-law's room had a number of nicks and dings in the furniture and smudges on the walls. It could be that it was more often used or that it was a room for the handicapped (see later notes). Our room had two queen size beds, a small frig, microwave, dishes and silverware. It was just right for our family of four (includes two teens). Kudos to the staff - when we checked in, my in-laws were put in a room on the 2nd floor. There is no elevator in Casa del Mar. Both of them are in their early 80's. After inspecting the room, they decided to request a room for the handicapped on the first floor, which the reception desk was quick to accommodate. In addition to being the size of a suite room with just a king size bed, the bathroom had special handicapped bars and a shower with no curb to step over. My in-laws were very happy with the room. We noticed that our room had a connecting door to the next room. This is good to know for large family groups. Hotel is near San Diego Airport and the naval base so there was the occasional loud plane overhead, but since we weren't in our rooms much it didn't matter. The planes also did not fly at night (or it was such that we did not hear or notice). Also, at least Casa del Mar, while updated, is an "older" building. The floor boards sometimes squeaked when a very heavy person in the room above us walked around. Staying on the 2nd floor would avoid this problem. Beds were a little too soft for us, but tolerable. They were clean. Casa del Mar and Island Palms each have their own swimming pool. I don't know about Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for our Rock 'n Roll Marathon weekend”
Reviews.Author: TuleCat
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in San Diego for the Rock 'n Roll Marathon. The Island Palms was close enough to downtown to be convenient to the expo and far enough to avoid the marathon craziness. The suite was a little dated and worn around the edges, but comfortable and clean. Especially appreciated the kitchenette, the roomy balcony and the free parking. The service at the restaurant was less than stellar, though. The place was nearly empty and we still couldn't catch the waitress's attention for water refills. We needed to hydrate!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Resorts.... The saga continues”
Reviews.Author: cobalt61
Reviews.Content: This resort appears beautiful on the exterior and indeed it is... The little details quickly get seedy as you go inside. I have a reasonable expectation when I pay ...Best Western Hotel.... "Resort Prices" ...as I have with Best Western in the past two weeks....to see adequate maintenance. At the restaurant, the ends of the roof beams in the outdoor section have rotted and appear ready to expose patrons to falling debris. The carpet in my room was worn and stained and the walls in the hallways need painting attention. In addition on the second day of our trip we were awoke by an obnoxiously loud child next door at 7:00 AM. The typical noise of a young child is to be expected during travel and usually its brief in nature however this child was loud and unsettling for nearly 2 hours ending any chance of our continuing to rest comfortably. This noise was obviously NOT from pain or distress, this was the increasingly common screaming and carrying on of a spoiled, unmannerly and "out -of- control" child. This is NOT the environment or the place to teach a child proper manners, do a practice run in Motel 6 perhaps! I mention this noise issue only because we were annoyed by the excessive noise at the Best Western resort in Friday Harbor the prior weekend (see my previous review) as well and this is rapidly appearing to be a trend ! With due consideration and thought, I have good incentive not to spend any more of my travel money with Best Western Resorts. They proved to me to be treating their RESORT properties little better than a roadside hotel.... Their reasonable if all you need is a bed to rest for a short time while on the road. Best Western has obviously purchased properties in resort locations however they need to learn that we who have money for resort travel expect reasonable control and accommodation for the additional money ! And as a side note..... Parents who travel with young children.... Please respect those quests who are not traveling with children and extend the common courtesy to keep your children subdued during the quite hours of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tjherrera
Reviews.Content: Everything about our experience was positive, and even better than expected. The location was fantastic for access to downtown and the San Diego Bay. Parking was free, although crowded. We stayed in a non-view room, but we still had a good view of the bay. In addition, we had a lovely patio. Everything from the courtesy of the staff to the cleanliness of the room to the location to the availability of laundry facilties was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Treeless
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel and location! We love coming to Shelter Island and walking in the park along the water's edge. When we can stay there too it's even better! Trip Advisor offered a special lower price on Memorial Day weekend here and we took it. The check in staff were friendly. The room was listed as a non view but we looked out over the parking lot to the park and water so we thought it was great! The room was clean. The bed was comfortable. The maid forgot to clean out the coffee pot the first day but did it the next day. The breakfast at the restaurant was good and it has windows looking out at the marina. The hostess and wait staff were very good. It was a very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Moqui_Girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in a non view Junior Suite in the Casa del Mar building. The room was a great size with a dining table for 4 and kitchenette (microwave and fridge plus crockery and cutlery). The room also had a door leading to a patio area and although this faced the building next door there were lots of plants/shrubs which made it a pleasant place to sit. The hotel has two pools, the smaller of the two being at the Casa del Mar building. The pool and hot tub was pretty quite for our whole trip and we often had the area to ourselves. The pool and hot tub are open until 11pm so we enjoyed and evening dip before bed, overlooking the harbour. There is also an outdoor fire which was lit later on in the evening so that guests could sit out even when it got a little colder. We had an offer for free breakfast at the hotel restaurant each morning (not including drinks). There was a wide variety of food available and both days I had the bakers basket (two pastries/muffins with a fruit cup) and it was probably the best breakfast of our whole trip. The restaurant over looks the harbour so the views are lovely and you can sit inside or outside. The hotel staff were super helpful and were very cheerful at all times. The car park was pretty busy during our stay but we always managed to get a space. The hotel is located an easy 10 min drive from the main attractions in San Diego and we found it very convenient to get back and fore. If I was in San Diego I would definitely come here again. Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Expectations met!”
Reviews.Author: yourimagination
Reviews.Content: We spent a night for a little getaway to celebrate our 10 yr wedding anniversary. The staff was very friendly and super helpful. We received a free upgrade to a suite after checking in to our Facebook as advertised on their fb page. The view was really nice and the room so comfortable and it had a nice beach house/resort feel. We really liked the peace and tranquility of the nightâ€¦we slept better than we had in a long time. The ducks were a little noisy early but that was okay. The only disappointment was the bar/lounge; we werenâ€™t really impressed. Overall it met our expectations and it was so nice to relax at a beautiful location. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star value”
Reviews.Author: 1vnlover
Reviews.Content: everything from check in to checkout was first rate. location fantastic, room excellent, service five star, staff excellent. Dining spectacular. Cannot rate our experience highly enough. what a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: siobhanc84
Reviews.Content: I booked a non-view king room in the Island Palms building and paid $99pn. There were signs for a wedding on our first night and I'd read reviews complaining about noise from receptions so requested a room away from the event. I was given a room at the edge of the property and it was very quiet. Our room was a reasonable size and the bed was comfortable. We were on the ground floor and the room entrance was under a staircase so there was very little natural light - we had to turn lights on whenever in the room. The hotel was lovely and Shelter Island is a great location. The pool by the marina is beautiful, especially at night when the fire is on. There aren't many places to eat nearby unless you have a car but that was fine for us as we wanted to explore. The staff were all excellent and very willing to help with silly questions like "how do I get to the zoo?". It took far too long for us to realise that there are directions to the most popular locations on the property map we were given on check-in! I don't expect non-view to mean no daylight at all so definitely wouldb't risk a room in that category again. I feel that the room we were given was poor value. Overall I'd stay here again but only in one of the more expensive rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely spot”
Reviews.Author: Hazeyjean
Reviews.Content: Shelter island is a pretty marina and this hotel is near the end, made up of several buildings. It was so much better than we were expecting. The reception area was lovely and it did indeed feel "palmy". Our room was in the newer building and we had a balcony looking out onto the marina, nice decor and quite spacious. The two pool areas were lovely with warm seawater and very hot jacuzzis, open from 6:00 till 11:00. One pool had a cozy fire, although this pool was closer to us, it was quite busy and we preferred the one nearer the reception, which was quite a walk from our room. Nice grill restaurant with freshly cooked food, although a little pricey. Whilst it is described as being a little way out, with a car, we did not find it too far to get to the top tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: RomanusRodrigo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the Marina. Its clean and welcoming. Our room was clean and comfortable. This hotel is on Shelter Island and we loved that we could look at the Marina on one side and the bay on the other...all within walking distance! The front desk service was VERY good. The free shuttle to/from the Airport was a plus! We would defiantly stay here again. We also enjoyed the restaurant that's part of the Hotel - Blue Wave Bar and Grill for Breakfast/Dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious rooms, great staff, and a very pleasant location. What more could you ask?”
Reviews.Author: Yes-Lets-go
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for two nights and it was terrific. Our junior suite was in the "Casa" section, which was very nice. The room was clean and spacious and had a balcony and kitchenette. Although it was officially a non-view room, we had a lovely view of the marina from our balcony. All the staff were courteous and helpful. Although they accidentally gave us a key to a room that was already occupied, the problem was quickly solved to our satisfaction. We only ate one meal at the restaurant (breakfast), but it was fine. And the location is quite nice -- you can walk on a footpath for quite a ways along the marina, and then around the end of the spit of land and back up the other side on a path along the ocean. Very pleasant for morning and evening strolls. We would certainly stay there again. One note -- we did hear the military aircraft that other people have mentioned in their reviews, and they were indeed quite loud -- but they were also quite rare. We thought it was a thrill to see them fly over so close. (It never happened early in the morning or while we were sleeping.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Christecc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely the QUIETEST hotel room I have ever stayed in, and that is saying a lot, considering that we travel extensively. It is on the water and has great views. The staff is very helpful, patient and friendly. The room was quite nice. Windows open so that you can get the nice sea breeze. Bed is super comfortable. Food was also super. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: cadnumjl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Island Palms the week following easter and we had an excellent stay! The hotel is in a great location to see everything, nothing was over 15 minutes away! The staff at this hotel is also amazing. When we were leaving for the airport we realized we forgot something in the room. We called the hotel and Hank, the front desk guy arranged for it to be delivered to the airport for us! The parking is also free which is hard to come by in San Diego. A note on parking if you are trying to save a few bucks on your vacation, if you arrive at seaworld an hour before they open, you don't have to pay for parking and also in the city if you park at the horton plaza parking garage you can get 3 free hours of parking as long as it's validated inside the mall and that parking is in a central location close to everything! Also, make sure you go on the seals tour and if you go to the Safari park make sure you do the zipline safari :) Oh, and make sure you visit Miguels by the hotel and get the guac!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for San Diego vacation”
Reviews.Author: M2Viking
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 1 week. We chose it based on reviews and budget. We were not disappointed at all with the choice and would immediately book this hotel again when we visit San Diego again. We found the location to be excellent. Beautiful scenery out both side of the Hotel. The lobby makes you think you have arrived in Hawaii. Lots of restaurants in walking distance but some of the best food we had during the week was in the Hotels Blue Wave grill. Staff were friendly and helpful and since we don't like housekeeping every day we put out the "Do not Disturb" sign and the front desk checked in with on the second day of DnD to see if we needed anything. Great service. Ocean beaches and Seaworld are just 15 minutes away by car and the Olde Town Trolley tours stops at this Hotel for pickup and delivery. Highly recommended and thanks to all of those who contribute to this site and made our choice successful. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Routine1
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in San Diego and really pleased we chose this hotel, lovely location, friendly staff and we got an upgrade to the new rooms which were just lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jim34059
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the jr suite in the Casa Del Mar on May 6-10. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Room was nice and bed very comfortable. It was a very peaceful setting around the hotel. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I'll keep returning to this oasis”
Reviews.Author: Andie_SoCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at an exceptional rate for 3 nights & wish it could have been longer. It was hard to believe that it was a Best Western --- the location and surroundings are beautiful and for the price it was remarkable. The bed was comfy, the room was a nice size & had more than enough amenities, we had a great marina view, and the staff were more than willing to make our stay a memorable one. We didn't get a chance to take advantage of the pool or the beach cruisers, but we definitely will the next time we're in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda4070
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd time I've stayed at the Island Palms and each time I have been very happy with my choice. The only drawback to this time was that I wasn't paying attention when I booked my room and accidentally booked the Casa Marina instead of Casa Del Mar. When the desk clerk told me my room had a nice view of the marina I told her I'd booked a bayview room. She said all their king-size bed rooms have marina views and I said the bed didn't matter, I wanted a bay view. I was given a bay view room, but it wasn't what I was used to. The room was nicer, yes, but the view was disappointing. In the future I will be sure to pay attention to which building I'm booking! hahaha. I'm only giving it 4 stars because of the view from my room and the front desk clerk didn't seem very friendly, which was unusual since the prior 2 times I've stayed there, the desk clerk was super nice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Lodging and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HowardTucson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Best Western Island Palms on Shelter Island, near Point Loma. We booked a double queen water view room, and signed up for the $9 upgrade to a queen suite (subject to availability). We were upgraded to the queen suite upon arrival -- more space, better view and a significant savings over the actual cost of the suite. Location was important to us -- we did not want to drive far to do the things we planned on doing. This hotel is within a 15 minute drive of the San Diego airport, and within a 20 - 25 minute drive of many of San Diego's attractions, including Balboa Park, the USS Midway (a must see), San Diego Bay cruises and Coronado Island. There is a wide selection of restaurants nearby. The Best Western Island Palms had the most comfortable mattresses and pillows, and was quiet at night -- all of which helped ensure a great night's sleep throughout our stay. The hotel and restaurant staff were courteous, and the hotel gave my wife a fruit basket for her birthday. We would not hesitate to stay at the Best Western Island Palms on future trips to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay! Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: nmmiller_99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Island palms during spring break. We were able to stay in the only villa on site. If you have a large family i would definately recommend the villa. It overlooks one of the two pools on site and the marina. Hotel staff was very friendly and knowledgable of the better restaurants in the area. Great location with easy access to the airport and downtown. It is also easy to get to I5 via Rosecrans St. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone. We will definately stay there again when we go to San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pre cruise”
Reviews.Author: rose in woods
Reviews.Content: I booked this after reading may reviews in San Diego to use as a pre cruise hotel and also for the car park as we drove from Oregon. This was the perfect arrangement for both. The front desk people were so professional and friendly. Our room was in the newer section in front of the marina. I loved the seagulls! Wonderful bedding and nice corner room with a little patio. Windows that open! What more can you ask. We had transport to cruise port by taxie paid by the hotel as their shuttle was tied up when we wanted to leave. They offered this service without us asking and picked us up when we called at the end of our cruised. Our car was in their covered garage for 10 days as no extra cost. The value of our stay was exceptional to say the least. We had dinner at the hotel and it was very tasty and also a good value. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Preh
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and bathroom was updated. Beds were so-so comfy. Great value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place. 2 warm pools 2 hot tubs. Nice restaurant. Very friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: shivits
Reviews.Content: We had room 203. Are room was a real suite with a full kitchen lots of free in room coffee Great view of the bay. We had a private little deck area. Nice quiet street more walkers and bikes and boats going by then cars. Feels like you are at a resort. Water on both sides. Seems like you are 10 minutes from everything in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Once Upon a Time!”
Reviews.Author: leelecc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what we needed! We don't get to travel much because of our large blended family. When we were picked up from the hotel by the funnest driver and dropped off at the hotel we were pleasantly surprised. It wasn't just a facade! The staff, the room, the view and the surroundings were so inviting. Comfortable, breathtaking views, serene and relaxing. We can't wait to return again! It was like our fairy tale trip!

Reviews.Title: “great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: mattabessett
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Island Palms with my spouse and children for 2 nights in April. The bottom line is that all of us mentioned that we wished we were staying longer than 2 nights because it was so nice. We stayed in the newer Casa Marina building in a room with a marina view. It was great to look out and see boats, people kayaking by, etc. The room was large and very clean, beds were great, bathroom was large and clean. The place was quiet and the two pools were great. We used the larger main pool, which was less than a 10 minute walk from our bulding. The hotel is on shelter island, which connects by a causeway to the mainland, and it is only about 15 min to a major highway junction near downtown. The location is beautiful and peaceful, but still very close to the action. Staff were very helpful when I needed something. The pricce was very reasonable for what you get. I would certainly want to stay here next time I am in San Diego. The only caveat is that you do need a car to get around easily from here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprises in Store...Central Location.”
Reviews.Author: Sukdog
Reviews.Content: Great location for your San Diego visit if it involves the San Diego Zoo, Sea World and beaches. Located on Shelter Island. Close to many shops, stores and restaurants. 10 minutes to the Zoo and 5 to 15 minutes to many the close beaches. Coronado is a 10 minute drive. The staff if very friendly, from check-in to room service to the on-site restaurant. Very responsive. Restaurant has good food. We had breakfast there most days as we had vouchers. We stayed in Queen Suite G-213 and it has an amazing view of the bay. We woke up and would watch boats and ships cruise by. There is a covered balcony off the living room. Comfortable beds. Kitchen, bathroom counter and shower is all granite!!! The pool is heated and is a really nice size (runs( 3ft to 8.5 ft) .Also has a hot tub. Both have view of the marina. You can hear neighbors sometimes but not too bad. Will certainly stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great pre-cruise location”
Reviews.Author: cruiser90
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel the night before a san diego cruise departure. They picked us up at the airport and took us to the port the following day. The hotel location is excellent. A room facing the marina is well worth the slight extra upgrade cost. The on site restaurant also had very good food at dinner and at breakfast. There is a beautiful walk along the marina and also a great waterfront park with a walking/jogging trail across the street. If you wish "quiet", the marina side is best, although this is away from city noise.

Reviews.Title: “What? What? I thought it was AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: PosadaRoyale30
Reviews.Content: I cant believe the other reviews of this hotel. I picked this hotel because it looked so beautiful, even though i was attending the RAGNAR relay in coronado island. I feel that this was the nicest property in all of san diego, and i have stayed in a number of places. I am a Best Western employee in Simi Valley, CA and I could not believe the caliber of hotel this was! I thought the best western i worked at was the nicest one i had ever seen, well this is just as nice, if not nicer due to the restaurant and double pool on property. It was absolutely beautiful, our room was amazing (it was a 2 queen suite). I have a feeling that this was a privately owned boutique hotel like my property, that took on the best western name, because it is not like the low cost, very simple best westerns i have seen in the past. I spoke to the night auditor who was very friendly, but didnt get a chance to visit the restaurant or speak to any other front desk agents. The only problem I had was with the room service. I had 3 Kids with me plus my husband, and ordered 4 orders of the pancake breakfast first thing in the morning. It took a long time to get, and they only brought the standard 4 syrups that fit in the little holder. I wish they would have taken extra notice and saw that we would of coarse needed more syrup. When i called the girl to ask for more to be brought up, she told me to come down and get it or i would have to wait a long time since they are busy. I couldnt believe it! 60 dollars plus a 5 dollar tip ( i didnt realize gratuity was included) and they cant bring me up syrup for my family to eat? it was a huge inconvienence and the girl that took my order was rude and should have realized that people order room service for a reason. i didnt want to get dressed and come down. Other than that it was a beautiful property and the rooms were WELL worth the price. I will definately stay again, just wont order room service in the future :)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: Sallybess
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more from this hotel. The "free breakfast" is a coupon for one of the options on the menu and didn't include drinks. We still spent $50 at breakfast for 6 with three of us being 8 and under. The rooms were dingy and kind of old. We contended with smoke smells and partying both nights. One night I called security. The other night was a wedding party. It was a fine place, but really nothing special. We were not made aware of any boat ride or free bike rental when we arrived like it says on the website. All in all it was just okay, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service first in a room with a view”
Reviews.Author: doctamale
Reviews.Content: I read numerous reviews before heading to San Diego for a quick weekend getaway, and this hotel was repeatedly scored very highly. When I saw the price... the room was mine. The hotel is a little out of the way for some I suppose, but we were a quick jaunt on surface streets for anything we wanted to see/do (seaworld/downtown), plus shelter island has a very laid back and detached vibe which was refreshing. The main lobby is beautiful with a waterfall and sort of tropical jungle feel (without being overdone). The front desk staff was prompt, courteous and just ... pleasant. We stayed in the Casa del Mar building on the second floor with a 'water view'. For our room this included both the marina and the bay, depending on which group of windows or balcony you ventured onto. Needless to say, the water lapping in the marina was a much needed reprieve from the day to day. The building was clean and spacious, as was the room. We had a comfortable, soft bed with clean linens, a large flat panel tv, comfortable chairs and a mini fridge. The shower, as has been mentioned, was a little dark, but not worse than many hotels and definately not like a "cave" as some have suggested. The pool was clean and very comfortable, and the spa has very powerful jets! There is a gas fireplace on the pooldeck and we watched the Seaworld fireworks from there. I called regarding room service and, despite a relatively late hour, they happily obliged my special requests. We visited the restaurant for breakfast and were happy to have a marina view while we enjoyed what I dare say is the best belgian waffle with fresh berries I have had in recent memory. All in all, the only thing I can think of that would make this any better was some sort of rapid checkout, though with a friendly front desk who can complain? I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay”
Reviews.Author: didgy2010
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Best Western Island Palms. The first time was March 2010. We had a good experience and were happy with room, staff, and location, so decided to stay there again when we returned this year. We were happy again. The beds were very comfortable. We had a queen suite, which was nice to have the extra space and option for cooking with two young children. Park across the street was great for keeping kids entertained early in the morning. Staff was very helpful. Rooms clean. Walls were a little thin, but didn't keep us from sleeping. We did, however, run the fan all night to provide white noise and help cover up noise outside the room. The view was great both this year and last year. This year we faced San Diego Bay, last year, the marina. Both are great views. Bay side gets more traffic, but again, noise wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service nice view and great price for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: wontstoptillidrop
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on 4/1/2011 to 4/3/2011 wonderful stay the room was spotless they gave us a somewhat secluded room facing the marina with a nice patio . It was the end of our honeymoon trip and this was the best place . We had one small issue with our breakfast but they corrected it right away and then comped us the breakfast . They we always asking us if there was anything they could do to make our stay better all employees were very attentive we were so empressed we will definately book our next stay there . They made our last two days of our honeymoon very memorable .

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, unsanitary ,useless manager”
Reviews.Author: bzmomm
Reviews.Content: After much researching we decided to stay here because the usual resort we stay in was all booked. We tried checking in at 2:30 and our room wasn't ready and the staff said they were sorry but their wasn't anything they could do because the rooms were still being cleaned. We came back after 4:00 and found short curly hair in our bedding sooooo awful! Then my two year old wanted to use the restroom and found the toilet seat cover had stool smeared on it. I called to speak to the manager he said he had nothing else available and that he would send someone but no one came. I called the manager again and finally at 8:00 pm we got fresh sheets.I felt so badly for my poor baby who had to wait around past his bed time for clean sheets. Will never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: nsmith4t2
Reviews.Content: BW Island Palms is the absolute best spot for visiting San Diego. The location is perfect, right on the bay and secluded enough to be truely peaceful; but also near everything! 5 minutes to downtown, Ocean Beach, Airport, Sunset Clifts, Zoo, everything! The staff is the main reason I recommend staying, genuinely customer service focused. you often lose service with brand name hotels, but not here. The staff is wonderful, knowledgeable, and ready to assist. Also have a great restaurant, 2 heated pools and 2 hot tubs; sit in the hot tub and watch the sailboats! Traveled with my partner and 14 year old son, all of us loved the trip and had a wonderful time, already planningn our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and peaceful surrounds”
Reviews.Author: SandiNJames
Reviews.Content: We only spent the night but this is not what you think of when you think about Best Western Hotels. It is actually 3 properties that are sort of interconnected and have a lovely marina on one side and a view of the bay on the other. Our room was in Casa Marina and was VERY impressive. When we were first assigned a room that was on the bay side, so I asked if we could be moved to a Marina view. The gal at the front desk gladly obliged. Moved us immediately to the other end of the floor. This turned out to be the perfect location. The beds are adjustable and very comfortable. I would highly recommend staying at Island Palms if you want a nice hotel but do not want to be in the heart of the craziness (Gas Lamp Quarter) yet only a few minutes away. Free Parking was also a big plus vs. $25-$30 in the downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not exactly what we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: JanetA000
Reviews.Content: Pros::: very friendly staff Nice locations free bike rentals (a lot of fun riding along the beach ) Two coupons for breakfast (which was delicious) two free tickets to the 1hr harbor cruise ( that was just ok but free) not too far from zoo and parks Cons:: website pictures are beautiful...real hotel is kind of old requested a room uspstairs to relax got one down stairs right below a family with a bunch of loud kids jumping up and down overpriced __ overall had a fun trip will have to think about staying there again staff did give us a percentage (10%)f our bill for not getting us an upstairs room

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: tnelson301
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful printed park tickets with no problem, cleaning staff was fantastic. My son had 3 stuffed animals he sleeps with. The cleaning staff set them up on the bed as if the were waving welcoming us in. The microwave and mini fridge are very handy since there is a grocery close by. Pool area well kept and boats along walk way are beautiful. Across the street from park and very short drive to anything you want to do. We loved every minute of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!!”
Reviews.Author: Juliebeans_11
Reviews.Content: I took my sister on a surprise 50th "Sisters" trip to San Diego. Wasn't sure where to stay, but when I came upon this hotel and "friended" it on Facebook, that is where the love affair began! The Manager suggested Shelter Island over Coronado Beach and Gas Lamp Square and I am so glad he did! The hotel was beautiful! I loved the Havana-style blinds on the window! The location at the Marina was so awesome to wake up to everyday! The hotel was within walking distance to the little town, and my sister and I used those strolls as our exercise! The room was clean and very spacious. We were upgraded to a suite, and were even sent champagne and chocolate covered strawberries one night! Jacob our van driver was more than gracious with the short trips he made for us to some quaint restaurants in the area! Old Venice was delightful! The nightlife was fun (what happens in San Diego, stays in San Diego!) and the Island Palms staff went above and beyond on customer service! I would DEFINITELY stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent will definately be back”
Reviews.Author: austin48
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself recently had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for 4 nights.I cant say enough about the location,service,and reasonable rates. The hotel is very clean,great food at the on site dining room,staff always helpful and attentive.Many other restraunts close by as well. We were in a suite on the marina side which was a beautiful room,room service was very fast! Close to San Diego but yet far enough away to have some peace and quiet. on site pool,hot tub,and,complimentary bikes to use. We also appreciated the use of the computer in the hotel lobby as we do not travel with a laptop. Congratulations to the staff for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bussiness stay not so enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Angnjason
Reviews.Content: First room we had the phone didn't work, the TV didn't work. We ended up fixing the TV ourselves after waiting for 30 min for someone to come fix it. The next day it again not working. They gave us a free breakfast for our troubles, however it was horrible breakfast. They did move us to another room which was better. Trying to do our online check in for our flight but their computer didn't work either. All in all we won't stay there again. Front desk people were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Property”
Reviews.Author: SCSTravelJunkie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one evening after a cruise. The property is older but appears to be well maintained. The location on Shelter Island is beautiful. We stayed in the Casa del Mar building. If we had it to do over again, we'd stay in the main Island Palms building to be closer to the amenities. Parking was free. Breakfast was not included. However, the location is within a quick drive to many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Our Third Visit In 2010!”
Reviews.Author: oldschool19461
Reviews.Content: We came for the Veteran's Day ceremonies aboard the USS Midway which coincided with my birthday. Front Desk Manager Matt Bickel graciously upgraded us to a King Suite to celebrate the occasion, how cool is that?! Even without the unexpected birthday present the Island Palms Marina and Resort is our hotel of choice in San Diego. We've stayed at both the downtown luxurious US Grant and the Westgate Hotels and you could switch the staff of either ones with the Island Palm's and I guarantee you could not tell the difference. Why do we no longer stay at the higher-end hotels? Simple, much more layed back relaxation at the Island Palms. We love the sound of seagulls throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing surprise of a hotel!!! Wish all hotels were like this!”
Reviews.Author: mfc1220
Reviews.Content: First, we booked a Junior Suite in the Casa Del Mar section (no view) for $139/night...we got SOOO much more that we bargained for with that room! If you walked out onto the balcony, we had a view of both the harbor and the bay, which we had not expected at all. The room was huge, beautifully appointed, modernized, extremely well-kept and clean! I cannot speak to the noise level because I wear earplugs, but my sisters had no problem sleeping in the room. The staff treated us like we were at a 5-star hotel, actually better than some of the 5 stars I've stayed. This is honestly the best hotel I've stayed in for the money! Not to mention, after I left I realized I left my blackberry charger in the room (which I never thought I'd see again). But sure enough, I received it in the mail today from the hotel. Exemplary Hotel and at amazing price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms but NO sound proofing and up all night!”
Reviews.Author: kristinehanna Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is wonderful, snuggled between the bay and the boats. The rooms are large and well furnished. The staff is friendly and very helpful. We would give this place 5 stars EXCEPT we have stayed here twice in the past year and both times we have been kept ALL night due to noise in the rooms next to us. The first time it was next door and the next time it was upstairs from us. You can hear every creak, every snore, every conversation. Just awful. The first time we thought it might have been a fluke (just noisy neighbors) so we tried again, which was a mistake. The staff does what it can but it is hard to love a place when you can not get a good night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: dearblackgoodbye
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel strictly off of reviews from tripadvisor and I'm so glad I did! The positive reviews are accurate, I can't wait to return! I stayed when they had a promotion to get a night free so I am hoping they do that again soon. The second I drove up to the hotel (free parking!) I knew I had made a good choice. The front desk was very nice and gave us a free upgrade! We had a few questions about the area & they were very helpfull. The Marina is beautiful, the rooms are comfortable modern & clean, and the location is perfect. At night we'd stroll across the street & just look at the beautiful views. We slept great, the area is nice & quiet, and is very close to restaurants and other sights to see. Sitting out on our patio sipping some wine & looking at the marina was fantastic. We didn't even have to pay for wi-fi! We are from New York & that is VERY rare, we are used to being nickle & dimed for everything but this hotel was the opposite, we loved it & hope to return very soon. I don't have a single complaint, other than I wish we stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, great views for the price”
Reviews.Author: Lakebem51
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. The front faces the bay across from downtown, your balcony overhangs a large marina. It's close to the airport without the noise. We stayed in their new marina building in a king suite. The hotel's own restaurant is quite good for breakfast and dinner. Be sure to walk down to the end of the street out in front. Good service at the front desk for travel tips and buying discount packages to the zoo and Balboa Park. A little trouble getting on their wifi so had to get cable to hook into LAN directly.

Reviews.Title: “They Try Hard, but the location and layout are not the best.”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Island Palms is a nicely maintained hotel on Shelter Island. If you are looking to be in the heart anything "San Diego" other than the marina, this hotel may not be for you. I was not at all impressed with this location or the layout of the hotel. The rates at this hotel seem to swing quite a bit, but when we were here there was an average deal. I was here for a conference and did not have a choice of hotel. I feel that there are much better options in Old Town if your wanting to stay on a similar budget but still be able to get to all the sights. (See my review of Holiday Inn Express Old Town) The lobby area is tiny and includes a check in desk, tiny exercise room, small bar area, and a restaurant. One of the two pools is adjacent to the lobby. One note to concern with this hotel.....though the rooms have an interior corridor, all first floor rooms look out on the marina or across the parking lot to the water front. Also, this hotel is a series of buildings, stretched out over about a 1/4 mile. You have to go outside to get from most of the rooms to the main lobby building. It was consistently a 10 minute walk from my building to the meeting rooms. These first floor rooms are not very secure in my opinion as there is not anything blocking out access to your patio. Between the scattered buildings, dark walkways, and first floor rooms I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who is security conscious. There also appears to be several people living in "campers" across the street from the hotel. There are not many good dining choices in walking distance. No convenience stores, and no fast dining options. You absolutely need a car to be happy at this location. Check in was efficient and friendly. They would not accommodate my request for a king bed, but they do have two queen beds in the double rooms. The rooms are of nice size, acceptable size and yet nicely equipped. Oddly, the bathroom door has an auto closer so it does not interfere with the front door...I had to cram a shampoo bottle in the door so as to let the bathroom vent when taking a shower.. Poor layout! Room decoration is warm and inviting and seemed to have been recently remodeled. The beds are sleep number, which I am not a fan of but they were good beds otherwise. The rooms have nice desk space, internet for (I donâ€™t know if there is a fee...they gave us access codes as part of our group package). They have nice HDTV's and an acceptable number of channels. Rooms have microwaves and fridges in them. The great thing about this location is that it is surrounded by water and you can get some nice but short runs in. Climate Control is acceptable and you can leave the blower on for white noise and still have the AC or Heat running. Their business center consists of one pc and printer in the lobby. They have two acceptable pools, both overlooking the marina. There is no breakfast included in the room rate, which for a Best Western is hit or miss. The food in the restaurant was acceptable given you were basically a captive audience. If you can get away, absolutely do so! The banquet food was acceptable but uninspired. The gym is way too small and unacceptable. Fortunately I went out running in the beautiful weather instead. Unless I did not have a choice, or got a killer deal, this would not be my choice at all, mainly because of the remote location (though easy driving distance to everything) and the stretched out layout of the facility. I just find that I prefer to be able to walk to at least a few places if I choose. The staff did try hard to make for a nice stay and the rooms were well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: krixi
Reviews.Content: Great Location! We stayed in a a suite overlooking the marina. Beautiful view! Just wish it was warmer so we could have enjoyed sitting out on the balcony Someone recommended the restaurant in the hotel. It is five-star dining and our best meals during our stay. And the STAFF,I can't say enough good things about them. They were all very friendly and courteous and helpful. We are already planning on staying here again on our next trip to San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views-can't wait to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jujubee780
Reviews.Content: A true hidden gem! When booking this hotel, I wanted something calm, serene, with water views and this place has it all! The hotel over looks either the marina or the bay depending on which side your hotel is on. The staff is friendly, the pool was in working order, the overall atmosphere was pure relaxation. Parking was free which is a major reason for choosing this hotel; other SD hotels were charging $20+ per night such as in the Gaslamp area or downtown. The location was close to the zoo, downtown, and everything we were in town to see or do. Bed was comfortable, and toiletries were of nice quality. The only thing I can complain about is that being on the lower level room, I can occasionally hear the guests above us walking. I can't wait to go back so that I can stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: ZMilan
Reviews.Content: This wonderful tropical hotel is my home away from home. Located on beautiful Shelter Island in a very quiet area. The staff is beyond friendly, the rooms are charming and the view from every room is incredible. I have been staying here for the past 5 years and would never consider staying anywhere else while visiting San Diego. The Island Palms is the best place if you are looking for peace and quiet in a tropical setting.

Reviews.Title: “Another great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: navymom123
Reviews.Content: I was visiting one of my Navy sons who was deploying soon and ended up extending my stay in San Diego due to bad weather on the east coast. The hotel I was staying in was already booked for my extended stay so I researched on Trip Advisor to find an alternative. The Best Western in Shelter Island was just perfect! Our room was upgraded to a double queen suite which was huge and very comfortable. Our view was overlooking the bay which was nice and offered a walking/running path along the water. Staff was awesome, the restaurant was very good and exercise room adequate for my needs. Shelter Island is a wonderful off the beaten track kind of place to stay and my son and I loved it. I will tell you though that you are right across the bay from North Island Naval Air Station (where my sons are stationed) and I happened to be there a week before my sons ship was deploying so there were lots of preparations being made for that. Which meant an awesome view of several Naval ships passing through the causeway there across the hotel. Great view of all the ships! There were sounds of helicopters for several days and for most of the day. I am used to it as you can here jets and helicopters around most of San Diego, but Shelter Island faces the runways and such on the base so you heard them constantly except not at night while sleeping. Just a not in case someone would be disturbed by all the activity. It was just an all around nice experience and I would definitely come back to stay!

Reviews.Title: “I was very pleased with my choice.”
Reviews.Author: litsusie
Reviews.Content: I made this reservation due to positive Trip Advisor reviews. My two adult daughters and I wanted to spend one night together in San Diego and I was limited on the amount of money I could spend. We stayed in the Gaslamp district of San Diego previously but wanted something quieter and near the water. This hotel fit the bill! Very affordable and comfortable. The room had a microwave and small refrigerator which was a nice bonus. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We were told the rooms on one side of the hotel look out to the marina and the other side looks out on the bay. We went to our assigned room on the third floor on the bayside but were surprised that we were above the parking lot, a road and then we saw the water. I called the front desk and asked if there was a room available on the marina side and was pleasantly surprised to find that there was. Our new room was on the second floor and it had a balcony. At night we could see the lights in the homes on the hills...very pretty! In the morning we saw out on the balcony and drank our coffee and had a beautiful view of the blue and white boats in the marina and the bay. It was a nice, quiet evening and morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for relaxation and kids too”
Reviews.Author: asdfgal
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel for all the family. Room looked brand new and was very comfortable. Fantastic water view from the room. Excellent restaurant on site and the benefit of two pools and two hot tubs. Venue just fantastic because of the flexibility: piano bars, restaurants and the pelican strewn pier all withing walking distance. Only a short drive from the zoo and downtown. Would definitely stay here again - we all loved it (even a sulky 16 year old!)

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back--next time with family”
Reviews.Author: Tridelt
Reviews.Content: I stayed in my first Best Western in Palm Springs a few years ago and was so pleased with everything, I gave the chain another whirl; this one in San Diego. Having lived in San Diego for 6 years, I hadn't really ventured out to Shelter Island and now I am wondering why on earth not. This hotel is so close to downtown, the airport, beach cities, Liberty Station and Point Loma with tons of attractions, I cannot imagine how people wouldn't find at least something to do here for days on end. It is clean, the staff is impeccably nice and it is so quiet. Wonderful for business travel but I want to bring my family here next. This is also the first hotel I have stayed in ages where I didn't wake up with an uncomfortable stuffy nose due to the bed or god knows what. So thankful for all the positive reviews or I wouldn't have found it!

Reviews.Title: “Quite, relaxing location”
Reviews.Author: itravel100
Reviews.Content: We travelled with 3 children and grandparents. We booked 3 rooms and stayed for 2 nights. The rooms were very clean, good size and had a beautiful outook over the marina. I booked this hotel because of its location on Shelter Island. It is across the bay from Downtown San Diego and next door to San Diego Yatch Club. It was close driving distance to Sea World. It was very quiet in the evenings and we all had excellent night sleeps. We ate breakfast at the hotel. The breakfast was not included in our room charge and we found it to be expensive. The hotel lobby and restaurant lacked atmosphere but the swimming pool was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property”
Reviews.Author: roscoe47
Reviews.Content: stayed here first week of january 2011. location on bay is fabulous with marina behind hotel and view of city in the front. amenities were above expectations from room to restaurant. staff is friendly and location right on the harbour is easy to get to from airport. great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place with family!”
Reviews.Author: seamom56
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews for hotels where to stay with our family. I really liked the reviews from Trip Advisor, so I went with what I read. We were primarily going to Legoland and I really wanted to stay up there, but all the hotels were booked. We also were going to Sea World and visit friends in Carlsbad with our almost 3 year old and 6 1/2 year old. We stayed at Island Palms for a week. Our room was facing the smaller pool and a marina. It was wonderful!! In some pictures they make the room look bigger than it really is. This was reverse. I couldn't believe how big the room was!! The bottom floor had a living room with tv/office work space for my husband. The couch was a pull out, but we didn't need it. A full bath too, so downstairs could be for a family or part of a family. Then there was a table near the kitchen. The kitchen had a small fridge, so we didn't get much things that needed to be cold. We got some cereal and fruit for breakfast in the room. There was a door that opened to the back view/pool area. Outside the door was a small table. So some mornings we would have the door open for air, or even sit outside. The kids would run around out in the grassy area or watch bugs on the cement. The pool was about 20 steps from our door. It was great! It was small, heated, and perfect. You could see the fireworks at Sea World every night. The upstairs to the room you have to go up a spiral staircase. There is another door to the upper floor of the hotel, but there isn't an elevator either. When upstairs you can shut the door so that no wandering kids would fall down the stairs at night. There is a full bath in the hallway. One room has a king with window, AC, dresser, tv. The other has the same, then a door to the upstairs balcony, and a full bath. The beds were very comfortable!! The AC on and the area of town, it was very quiet at night. We had room service 2 mornings for hot eggs, meat. Food was great. We never ate in their restaurant. The main pool looked fun as they have curbside service, but our kids thought the water was colder there. While this is in Point Loma, it's a little off the beaten path, but not too far. There is a Vons nearby, banks, and Starbucks. We had a routine of getting coffee, then getting to our theme park. A fun family restaurant very close by is Corvette Diner. Has an arcade, full bar, music. We went the first night and meant to get back. The carpet could use some updating, our downstairs bathroom toilet flooded the day we were leaving, but those were such minor things. It was so comfortable for our family!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quiet location, close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: flyfishingBC
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location and great staff. Hotel was by far the best value for condition of hotel we found in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Just like Motel 6...except by the Marina”
Reviews.Author: supermancritic
Reviews.Content: The most uninspiring hotel I have been. Its adequate but hardly exciting. Rooms are boring as watching paint dry. I usually rate a room on 'do I want to leave it?'. Yes I did! As soon as I walked in. Sure its by the Marina and Bay but what can you do with that? Sneak into a boat and take a spin? Nope. There is absolutely nothing around this area. Scrappy neighborhoods, near a typical big road lined with fast food joints (Rosecrans) and thats it. I kicked myself for not staying downtown at 4 star Hilton or Indigo downtown. Sure you gotta pay for parking but at least you get some LIFE around you. Endless restaurants are downtown in walking distance, promenade, museums, movie theatres, cruise ships, clubs, Aircraft carrier, Little Italy, etc. This hotel is located on the 'darks side of the moon' and nothing happening there are anywhere near! In this hotel **You have to drive just to get anything worthwhile**. price should have been half. THE ROOMS- are just like a Hampton Inn; Boring and unimaginative. The hotel site photos sell the 'belle of the ball' rooms with super photography. 90% of the rest arent like that when you are in them. I saw several in two different buildings as I walked around hoping there was better than what I got (casa del mar section). Older section was just as boring and basic. If you can score a hotel downtown 4 star with Hotwire for $90 like I saw, do it. Then you are right in the mix. Here you are just on some island looking across the bay toward downtown wishing you were over there. Downtown is only 5 min from Airport. And most are tall and modern giving amazing views. Do yourself a favor and save the hassle of driving permanently to get to quality establishments and stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: southguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights at the end of November and we were pleased with the welcoming and given attention and all the explanations we needed to know, to visit the area. We had a nice room with a Marina view and the Hills. So quiet and relaxing. It was the perfect location to visit Seaport Village, The San Diego Zoo, ''Old Town'' and Coronado Island. We wished we could have stayed longer. Nice restaurant on the premises with excellent food. Courtesy of all the staff have to mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “The Queen suite was spacious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Zareeba
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before in a "standard" room, and thought it was OK. This time we spent the extra money and stayed in a queen suite. What a difference a little space makes! If you travel with children and have the need to prepare meals while on the go (like a bowl of cereal, or heat up a cup of cocoa), then you will enjoy a suite at this hotel. It was very clean and comfortable. Every room was large. The bathroom had ample room for multiple people to shower and get ready (no tub). The bedroom had a closet in addition to several dresser drawers. The "living" area had a large flat screen TV, couch and coffee table. The kitchen had glasses, mugs, plates, silverware, a full sized coffee maker (though no filters), a pantry, and a full sized refrigerator. These amenities were especially useful given that it was raining outside which meant we spent more time in the hotel room than usual. There's children's play set across the street next to the water. As an aside, if you want to stock up the pantry, your closest grocery stores are off Rosecrans and Womble. There's a Trader Joe's and a Vons. If you go to that complex, do yourself a favor and have a meal at the Tender Greens restaurant. It's freshly prepared daily specials are fast, delicious, and healthy. The restaurant attached to the hotel has a great vibe and view, but the food is so-so. The queen suite we stayed in did have a latch up high enough so that the toddler couldn't open the door. We were grateful for that latch since she did try to open the door herself several times. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: sea_cruise86
Reviews.Content: I usually don't stay at Best Western, but the photos of this property I found online were enough to get me to try it. Wow! I was impressed with this hotel. They offer a free airport and cruise ship shuttle as well as park-n-sail and fly-n-sail parking. I have stayed in many hotels in San Diego throughout the years, but this is by far the biggest bank for your buck. I most certainly will be returning to this hotel again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good value”
Reviews.Author: calitonc
Reviews.Content: Our building had clearly been remodeled recently, and the decor was pretty stylish - accurately portrayed in the recent photos. Very clean. Its right on the marina which is fun for walking and just about a 10 minute drive from downtown. We didn't hit up the pool or anything, but we enjoyed our stay and would visit again. The staff at the front desk were very friendly - exceptional customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: MEAS512
Reviews.Content: Very best place to stay in San Diego, one could confuse it with a five star hotel. Excellent value, terrific staff, lovely grounds, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you are staying in the newly renovated w/o children”
Reviews.Author: gnmartin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the end of October w/two small children and changed our reservations at the last minute from another well known hotel. We checked in and were given a "quiet" room on the back of the hotel, the ocean and a steep hill directly into it was right out the main door to the room we discovered. In fact, we had to walk from the parking lot, in the grass on stepping stones to get to the room on the back of the building. We did not even go in the room, as the safety issue with two small children was too great. I requested a different room, which they provided at the opposite end of the complex. Parking was good, room was small, the front door opened about an inch or two from the foot of one of the beds. It was a long evening, as my toddler loved playing w/the blinds which opened up right to the parking lot and could easily open the deadbolt on the door, which opened directly to the parking lot. Again, a safety and privacy issue for us. The room was partially renovated (bathroom only) a bug crawled out of the shower mat, carpet was worn, linens worn, but the TV was brand new. Wonderful view though, nice patio, great little walking path and beach area across the street, and the hot tub was not bad. The pool, although heated was too cool this time of year. We checked out early due to the safety and privacy issues, but also it just was not what we expected and was the most expensive place we stayed in California. We were later informed we could have upgraded, but for the price we expected more than they delivered. Would recommend to people w/o children that stay in the newer/nicer part of the hotel, not the old part. We did not know the difference when we booked it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service and outstanding value!”
Reviews.Author: homebody25
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 25th anniversary trip to San Diego. We stayed at the Island Palms during this time and we could not have been happier with our choice! We were treated very well and the entire staff was kind and professional. Everyone always had a smile for us wherever we went. When spoke with other guests, the majority were there for a repeat stay. We will recommend the Island Palms to our friends and family and will definately stay here again when we decide to take another trip to San Diego. The city of San Diego is also a must visit for anyone. History, beaches, shopping, food, you name it they have it! We loved every minute!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in S.D.”
Reviews.Author: Oroldgraymare
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Palms many times and have never been unhappy with our choise. The rooms are nice and all have a balcony. Great for relaxing and watching the big ships. If you don't eat in the Hotel, there are plenty of good places near by. The staff was always polite and courteous. One even went out of his way to make our stay more pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel (motel?) with 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Mailmanwill
Reviews.Content: Very prompt check-in and had a small room in the older section. Nice small room but a little dark. They will gladly upgrade your room to the newer section if the hotel (motel?) isn't full. Newer section 3 stars older 2 stars. Service is very good, if you have any questions or need something (ex. corkscrew) they will help you right away. Nice place to have a morning walk . I found the fitness room very small, almost a joke. Have you ever bench pressed with someone sitting on your lap? The two pool areas are nice and well kept up. Great prices on Hotwire so I would recommend this hotel to anyone with any family on a budget who would like to visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice grounds”
Reviews.Author: arianatravel
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to have a suite that opened to the back side of the hotel towards the marina and the board walk, which were extremely nice. The grounds are just amazing! The kids loved the pool and the hot tub. Beds were very good, kitchen came in handy! Would have been nicer if breakfast was offered. The location of the hotel was great, with the beautiful marina and close to Downtown. Definitely a good value! Isabela Denver, CO

Reviews.Title: “If your going to be in S.D., a definite hotel to consider”
Reviews.Author: rayjay12002
Reviews.Content: After looking at the reviews on this site and the hotel's location we decided to make a reservation at the B.W. Island Palms. I liked the location as it was not on Harbor Island therefor it wasn't near the flight path at the airport and it seamed like it would be tucked away from the hustle and bustle while still being near all of the city's attractions. Well, these fact turned out to be very true. It is a very quite area. What the pictures and the reviews don't explain is that there is a very nice landscaped parkway across the street which is a great place to take a run, a after dinner walk, or to just sit on the benches and enjoy the view. The hotel is very easy to find and is close to the highways. The check in was effortless and the room was super nice. We stayed in the Casa Marina building and the room was updated, fresh, and new. The finishes (tile, wallpaper, etc) were very tasteful and upscale. The balcony overlooked the marina and was private enough to have morning coffee and overlook the boats. The hotel has two pools and two hot tubs, but a word of warning that at least the main pool was a salt water pool. I prefer a fresh water pool, but this one was very clean and still enjoyable. The staff was very friendly. On our first day, we went for a swim and was promptly greeted by Sunny who offered to get us a couple of drinks poolside. We walked by some of the other rooms on our way to the pool and they looked very nice as well but were efficiencies on two levels and they had a full kitchen so it looked like a great option for an extended stay. We optioned for the Seaworld Tickets through the hotel and to our surprise they were 5 day return tickets! All in all, a very nice experience. Breakfast was included with the room which was very nice, but they do charge for the drinks. i would never eat breakfast at their restaurant if I did not have the package deal because otherwise it would cost $30 + just for breakfast for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest Surprise In San Diego”
Reviews.Author: oldschool19461
Reviews.Content: Outstanding staff, restraunt, maintenence. Excellent view of Marina and especially Point Loma at night.

Reviews.Title: “A complete package - can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: jlb718
Reviews.Content: Bottom line, a very pleasant experience. We look forward to returning. Best Western has a gem in this location! We stayed here on our first visit to San Diego (daughter recently moved here to be with husband stationed at USMC Miramar). We originally booked at a nearby hotel which, unfortunately, did not meet our standards when we checked in. We set out to find different accommodations and wandered upon the Island Palms. This place has it all - EXCELLENT customer service (Kris and Greg set the tone right at check-in and Greg was there to send us off when we checked out with a smile and well wishes), location, view, marina, on-site spa, nightlife, great food, etc. The hotel rooms are clean and spacious. The hotel restaurant - "The Blue Wave" had happy hour specials, good food and friendly personnel. A well-known live concert venue is next door featuring nightly music and summer concert events. Point Loma is immediately behind the resort with a nice neighborhood setting and nearby historical areas. It is minutes (non-highway) from Liberty Station - a brand new shopping center by the Marine Recruit Depot, the airport, downtown, Coronado, Mission Beach and Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, and very comfortbale stay!”
Reviews.Author: skibumma70
Reviews.Content: I am absolutely thrilled with everything at the Best Western Island of Palms. From the minute we walked in, all the staff here treated us with the utmost respect and courtesy. From the guys at the front desk, the cleaning staff, and the people in the Blue Wave restaraunt. I cannot say enough about how professional, friendly and courteous that they were. We paid for a marina view and when we arrived, they upgraded us to a suite overlooking the bay. The suite is absolutely beautiful. Two flat screen tvs (bedroom and living room), sofa, open concept full kitchen with fridge and stove. Coffee maker in room, and balcony overlooking the bay. It was in the older part of the complex but exceptionally maintained, and I cannot say a bad thing about the room at all. My newlywed wife was thrilled to say the least, as was I. It was much better than expected. The location is fantastic, as you can go for long walks along the bay in the morning. It is close to everything, and easy to get into downtown or wherever you want to go. We wanted to take a trolley tour, and just missed the Old Town Trolley, and would have wait another 40 mins. The staff at the front desk saw that we were disappointed, and immediately offered to drive us to Old Town. I told them that we would wait, but they insisted that it was no problem, and took us on the shuttle to Old Town. It was something they just didn't have to do. Even the waitstaff in the Blue Wave restaraunt was top notch and went out of their way to make you feel comfortable and at home. I highly recommend eating at the hotel restaraunt if you do stay here. The food and service are both comparable, if not better than any restaurant in San Diego. We were pleasantly surprised. Pool and jacuzzi are clean also. Well worth the money, and we hate to leave here to go on to our next destination. Thank you Best Western!! We will be back again, I guarantee it!

Reviews.Title: “The only place we will ever stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: madrigal_singer
Reviews.Content: This was our second stop at the Island Palms and yet again the service, location and rooms were perfect for us and our budget. Having two children under 3 we definitely need a second room if they are going to get any sleep and if we are going to be able to stay up past 7:30 pm! We have now stayed in King Suites in both the original hotel building and the Del Mar building and LOVED both rooms. They are spacious, clean, comfortable and perfectly outfited for a family. Both rooms had beautiful views of the Marinas and were cooled by the breezes off the water. Both rooms also had outside spaces, including, this last stay, a great "front lawn" area with a table where our girls could play while we ate and where they could chase the friendly ducks. The beds are ridiculously comfortable, the parking and wifi are free, the tvs are big and the water pressure is strong...all the things I want in a hotel. But there is more...the most responsive and friendly staff ever...they even gave my 2 year old pennies to throw in the fountain. Problems are handled immediately and with graciousness. And the location is great, a playground across the street, restaurants on site and short rides away, Seaworld within 5 minutes, Old Town and Downtown similarly close. This is our home away from home and the ONLY place we will stay in San Diego from here on out!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: t2beans
Reviews.Content: The room that we were given was small with 2 queen size beds. It was clean and bathroom looked newly renovated. Staff was friendly. Great location. Would stay here again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: seattlematt1956
Reviews.Content: Delightful "Gem" in the middle of paridise. Clean, plesant decor, great location. The two room suite with two queen beds was perfect for traveling wih family. Great location if you have a car. Short easy drive to all San Diego attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: rerewill
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Island Palms Hotel and Marina in September 2010. The room is spacious and had a view of San Diego Bay that can't be beat. The staff is unbelievably courteous, and helpful. The restaurant is top notch. The Palms is close to all major attractions. Definitely I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liesl13
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here at the end of our 4 week USA trip. It was fantastic. The location was great, and really easy to find. You literally exit the Interstate 5 and drive down Rosecrans several blocks to Shelter Island Drive. And it's only 10 minute drive to Old Town, Sea World and the airport. The staff were very welcoming and very helpful. We had our GPS system stolen out of the car two weeks earlier and when I told them that they insisted on providing us with instructions and maps from Map Quest wherever we were going. There is a small internet desk for guests, but when this was in use it was much faster for them to provide us with the instructions. We had a king size waterview room in Casa del Mar. A very nice sized room with all amenities: fridge, coffeemaker, microwave and a balcony. Directly outside Casa del Mar is a swimming pool with hottub, and when we were there in mid-September it was not at all busy. Great for relaxation after a day sightseeing. I have seen on another posting that they offer drinks and meal service at this pool. Maybe we were too late in the season for that because we didn't see this service all 3 times we were at the pool, but it was unimportant for us anyway. One morning there were no pool towels available but once we asked for them they were brought out quickly. The only complaint we have is that our neighbors would order room service in the evening, and the used plates were still outside their room next morning at 8 am. Unfortunately they were into seafood and the plates smelt pretty awful next morning. But other than, everything was fine. We ate both breakfast and dinner in the hotel restaurant. See my comments on that in a separate posting on "Blue Wave Bar & Grill. We were also given good advice for a restaurant nearby: Brigantine Restaurant. See also my separate posting on that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Pleasant! Want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: MairAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Aside from less than perfect directions from front desk, a wonderful stay. Beautiful accommodations, great decor, great view, lovely grounds, helpful staff, GREAT price. Would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Quiet Spot with Tropical Location”
Reviews.Author: Msemengr
Reviews.Content: My 20 yr old daughter and I stayed for 9 days at the Casa Del Mar 2nd floor room in which the balcony overlooked the marina. The palm trees and water provided a tropical feeling. If you don't want the high rise hotel, valet parking fee, internet fee feeling this is the place to go. You are 5 minutes away from downtown San Diego and best part free parking and internet. Hotel had two pools the main one has a restaurant and bar the smaller one at Casa Del Mar has staff coming by to take orders for drinks and food. We went to the pool at some point every day and its open until 11 PM. On the other side of the hotel is a public park/ walkway that was great to walk on each night. The hotel next door Humphrey's by the Bay has an outdoor theater so each night we could listen to the entertainment for free. Also we could see the fireworks from Sea World from our balcony every night. Staff was great no issues with housekeeping, front desk or the pool area everything was clean. If you like the beachy tropical palm tree feel this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “RESORT-LIKE WATERFRONT SUITES”
Reviews.Author: MikeTObaby
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, San Diego was the worst place to go in terms of dullness and boring people. I will never go back to that boring place ever again. However, if you must go I would definitely recommend this hotel as an alternative option. Even though it did not offer breakfast, with the low rates you could just as well purchase one at dennys or mcdonalds. The suite we stayed at was only 1 yr old and had 2 swimming pools with amazing views. This is just like a resort and helps with the dullness of the city it is in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - I would recommend it to anybody.”
Reviews.Author: anniessis
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary. We could not have found a more perfect place to stay than the Island Palms Hotel and Marina on Shelter Island. We were in the Casa Marina building, third floor room, wonderful view of the bay. The hotel had complimentary champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries waiting for us in our room. Every staff member that we encountered was courteous, friendly and helpful. The room was large and very comfortable. We never heard our neighbors unless we both happend to be on the balcony at the same time. We felt that with all the amenities we got good value. We will go back and we will recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite place!”
Reviews.Author: DebbyT4
Reviews.Content: The building we stayed in was newly renovated and was immaculate. The beds are the kind that you can adjust the firmness, great. The window covering was full length sliding (3 panels) shutters! You could still get light in and have privacy, plus you could adjust the amount of light you got, just like at home!! Okay, so the view was great! There was a small play area across the street for kids (swings) and their was a pier to fish off of and some beach to have a fire. You could see downtown San Diego across the bay very easily since there were no clouds to be found! Everyone was friendly. Then there was the marina....beautiful! I would love to retire here with my husband and just enjoy life!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't quite meet our expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Claire2811
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Island Palms for 2 nights as part of a 2 week tour of California. The hotel is in a fairly quiet location on Shelter Island and offered free parking, but is approximately 15 min drive from central San Diego and the main tourist attractions. Our room was fairly average, given the star rating of the hotel and as a ground floor room only had a view over the car park which was disappointing. In general the hotel didn't meet our expectations based on the other reviews we had read. If we were travelling to San Diego again we would choose a hotel within walking distance of downtown San Diego as parking can be quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice view”
Reviews.Author: linnde
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night and had a marina view room. We arrived near sunset and outside our room was a small grassy spot with lawn chairs overlooking the marina. My guy and I had a bottle of wine and enjoyed the quiet setting and beautiful sunset over the marina. I had to catch an early flight so can't say much more other than just enjoyed those moments so much and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish our Plumbing problems were solved in a timely fashion.”
Reviews.Author: grngirleee
