Reviews.Author: cruzinqueen728
Reviews.Content: Thank to everyone on this site who helped me pick Best Western Island Palms on Shelter Island. We had two Junior Suites on the 2nd floor of the Casa Del Mar building, it was a pain to carry our luggage up the stairs, but the view was worth it ! My family was so impressed with the hotel, others also vow to return. The Junior Suites were large and clean. It did take until after 4pm for both rooms to be ready. We used this hotel for a pre-cruise stay, as did over 40 others ! The restauraunt is very nice, but expensive. We also ate at Humphreys, which was more expensive, and nicer. We also ate at the Edgewater Grill in Seaport Village, not as expensive, but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: MTommy
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with a family in San Diego, I think this would be an ideal hotel. Large rooms, spacious bathrooms, parking included (which is nice because it is a ways away from the night life of downtown), a lot of nice things that many hotels in the area charge a lot more for! All in all, we could not have been happier with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jhduvall
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, feels like and looks like a 5 star hotel. The grounds are BEAUTIFUL, right across the street from the bay. Your only 5 mins away from downtown SD. I have stayed there several times and will contunine to return

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Tropical Oasis along the Bay”
Reviews.Author: ronrayada
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Island Palms for 4 days, 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Great location, very relaxing and quiet during the latter part of September. We were sometimes the only ones at poolside. We liked the pool in the older section for it's tranquil, serene ambiance. Tiki torches are lit at night giving it a balmy polynesian flair. The tropical plants and palm trees make you feel like your at some exotic locale. Both pools have a great marina view with the Pt. Loma hills in the distance. Our room was in the newer section of the resort, the Casa Del Mar building, which had a bay view and I enjoyed watching the ships go by from the balcony. We really enjoyed taking walks along the shoreline which has fire-pits, a small sandy beach, also picnic tables and grass. One night we walked over to the Bali Hai restaurant for dinner, which was very good - the views of the San Diego cityscape at night are incredible. Be sure to reserve a table by the window, very romantic. The hotel has free parking, which is nice, plus free bikes to use to run around Shelter Island. The only downside was when we were awakened at 5:45 am by a fire alarm that sent everyone scurrying outside, only to discover it was a false alarm. The fire dept. came and did a sweep, we were all a bit dazed, but glad it was nothing. They didn't know why it went off. The newer building is still in the final finishing process and maybe that could have attributed to a malfunction, who knows. The hotel could have offered something for the shake-up, but didn't. That would have been a masterstroke on their part had they done that, but even that didn't really diminish our stay. At least the fire alarm works well... overall we would go back again, it's a great value for the money and the room was clean, acceptable and quiet and all the staff pleasant. The weather was also fantastic when we were there, never went above 85 degrees during the day with clear blue skies and slight breezes, typical San Diego weather which is why we love it there.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestHusker
Reviews.Content: We own a small retail business in the midwest and work long hours six days a week. The Island Palms was exactly what we needed. It is in a beautiful location. Our quiet, comfy second floor room in the newest building was excellent! Our deck had a view of the bay and a friendly hummingbird breakfasting in the bloom of a large Bird of Paradise plant. Great food in the restaurant and very helpful people in the lounge and front desk. Love the sunrise!

Reviews.Title: “Great base camp for college friends”
Reviews.Author: Sarge13
Reviews.Content: I traveled with 6 other friends (college aged) and stayed here for 3 nights. Great location: central to downtown, Pacific beach, the major roads, major attractions. Nice rooms, friendly service, and great fridge in the larger rooms. Nice view of the marina and newly renovated quiet pool area. Parking can be tricky if arriving late on the weekend. Overall, nice place, will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: lovetheweather
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews and wasn't at all disappointed. We stayed 5 nights in suite 206 which overlooked the marina. We originally booked a room at the Bristal in the Gaslamp district and after driving to a Padres game at Petco Park were extremely happy we changed to the Island Palms. Gaslamp is fine if your into the nightlife, noise and concrete. We wanted a more relaxing vacation. I have to give Danny & Cherise at the front desk 5 stars. When we arrived back at the hotel after the ballgame late on the Saturday night the parking lot was full and Cherise offered to move her own car to the street so we could park in the lot (uncommonly busy night). Danny was always very friendly and helpful with directions and very pleasant to deal with..Our suite was exceptionally clean and comfortable. There was only a shower and I do enjoy a hot bath, but not a big deal, and I did find it a little chilly on the deck but my husband loved the cool breeze off the water. The restaurant food was excellent and reasonably priced. The pool was heated and very clean. The pool bar was closed for the season, but that was OK. Free parking was a definite bonus. The Bristal was going to charge $30.00 per day. We would definitely return to the Island Palms.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Give it One More Try”
Reviews.Author: SarahM71177
Reviews.Content: I've been following the reviews on this hotel for months both prior to booking and once we booked it. We (myself, my husband, my 4-year-old daughter and my 11-year-old son) visited September 3-6. The location of this hotel is unbeatable! A short drive to everything and the views were amazing. We stayed in building J, room 223 (an Island Palms suite). As I said earlier, I've reviewed all the comments on this site and I reviewed the Island Palms website. Subsequently, I requested that we be put into a Villa or, in the alternative, the Casa Del Mar suites. Without going into great detail, neither happened despite multiple phone calls and an email exchange. I wasn't thrilled and definitely noted the issues but the room we were placed in was nice enough. That said, we also discovered an ant problem the second day we were there. We had our food on the counter (in the packaging) in the kitchen and there were ants all over the counter. There was a miscommunication with maintenance and it took them approx 2 hours (and 9:15 PM) to show up and spray which I was really unhappy about. I contacted the manager who worked with maintenance to get rid of the ants (which was unsuccessful) but he was very nice and tried his hardest to get rid of the ants. He didn't offer a discount but did call and offer us breakfast, unfortunately, he called after we had already checked out. I think some sort of refund would have been in line but am not going to dwell on it. Our room had a full kitchen but it didnâ€™t have a stove. I would have given the hotel a better score if it had. Also, the beds were okay but we have slept in more comfortable. The pool was fantastic and the other guests we spoke with were very nice. Actually, most of the people we spoke with visit the property annually. Iâ€™m hopeful that our experience was unusual seeing how satisfied the other guests were and have been in the past. Our room was quite and we didn't have an issue with parking. All in all, I was about 75% satisfied with our stay but plan to give it another try next year and hope that things work out better. On a side note, we ate dinner and breakfast at the restaurant on site. It was pretty good and very convenient (they will bring dinner to you while you lounge at the pool).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mj_chan
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this Hotel was perfect. Location was perfect, on a small island (Shelter Island) in San Diego Bay. Room: We stayed in the new part of the Hotel, this may be important as other review indicate. The room was very large, clean, had card access to hallway and patio - we were on first floor. We were on the bay side, and though a small parking lot was outside our door it was still very pleasant to sit on the porch and we had a great view of downtown and the bay. This hotel and location was not overloud but I could see someone with sensitive ears not enjoying it. From the birds, to ships with horns, and the occasional naval helicopter, and the possibility of noisy neighbors. Hotel: Service was immediate and responsive. We were not able to check in early (though hotel information on their web site indicated this so I was prepared for the possibility). There are two small pools more appropriate for kids, and the one in the older part of the hotel has a full service bar. During our visit neither was overcrowded but they are small enough that there is no element of privacy. The grounds a beautiful and nicely maintained, and have a definite tropical feel to them. Location: Just across the street is a fishing pier, and a very short jaunt down the street a very nice beach. A very short drive from the airport, downtown, really all touristy activities in the area are immediately accessible from this location â€“ and as a side comment I was very impressed with San Diego as a whole as a vacation destination. Not everything was perfect but nothing was an issue â€“ parking could be better but it is free. It was a perfect place to relax after our days exploring the area. I explored the other two hotels on the island and would say you probably couldnâ€™t go wrong with any of them on this island.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, inexpensive for the quality”
Reviews.Author: Shellsw7
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here - our room was very nice and in a nice location away from the beaches and dowtown but near enough to explore everywhere. San Diego itself is lovely and not too busy considering its a main city. We got a good deal on this hotel and decided to arrive early and stay an extra night - the reception staff were really helpful and accommodated us at the last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Room was awfull”
Reviews.Author: dawn0969
Reviews.Content: On arrival our room was not ready but not a problem after around a 30 minute wait we were given another room, we could not open the door fully as one of the beds was in the way were they had crammed two beds in, our first view was the long strip of wallpaper hanging off in the bathroom and turning back looking at the front door having an inch cap under the door, as we were on the ground floor any bug could just get under and straight into bedroom not a nice thought, reported problems and around 2 hours later a maintence man came and sorted things out, the actuall beds were so small that me and my husband struggled to sleep they were only slightly bigger then a single bed, we had a room with two doubles as had a teenager with us, Thge actuall hotel was very nice and the staff at the front desk were very cheerfull and polite but the room we stayed was just so dissapointing

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - if you book your room carefully....”
Reviews.Author: nighthollo
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel on Shelter Island, close to downtown but without the noise. Book an upstairs room if at all possible, or you may end up with a great view of parked cars. The marina side of the hotel is quiet, almost to the point of boredom, but the side looking out toward the city and the bay is really very interesting from the second floor, and still very quiet at night. Frequent passage of huge cruise ships and naval vessels is very common. The Casa del Mar junior suite was superb, with a large balcony, but a word of caution - if you book through one of the sites such as Expedia or Travelocity, you might find that your "waterview" room actually faces the wall of another building, and you can see a tiny bit of water only if you are standing at your window or out on your balcony. Balconies in the Island Palms section of the hotel all appeared small, and seemed to face mostly sideways toward the adjoining buildings. The Casa Marina section was still under construction during our stay, but looked as though it would be quite similar to the Casa del Mar section for views, balconies, etc. The restaurant on site at the hotel was pleasant, with views out over the marina, and very nice food. All the staff with whom we had contact in any section of the hotel were exceptionally pleasant. If it fits into your plans, try breakfast or lunch at the Bali Hai Restaurant at the far end of Shelter Island, and Sunday brunch at Tom Ham's Lighthouse Restaurant on neighboring Harbor Island is out of this world, and simply not to be missed - but make reservations early, it's very popular!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, new, clean rooms and gorgeous views!”
Reviews.Author: akmom61
Reviews.Content: First of all...let me say that we stayed at the brand new building that is called Casa Marina, it's also the furthest building from the lobby. I encourage you to stay in this one or the Casa Del Mar building, next door with the mini suites. The minute we walked in our building, it smelled new and so clean! The room was large and airy and had a huge flat screen tv, a balcony overlooking the marina, 2 cozy queen beds, a large desk that the tv sat on and housed a small microwave and refrigerator and a separate area with chairs and small table by the balcony. The bathroom was large and had all the modern amenities. The only thing the bathroom lacked (in my opinion) was a fan. We were very impressed with the overall experience.... On the other hand, my first impression of the lobby was kind of small, dark and musty smelling. The shuttle driver that picked us up from the airport, Kyle, was friendly and helpful and knowledgable about the area and had great suggestions. We got picked up from the downtown Amtrak station. When we got to the hotel, since we were there earlier than the normal ck in time of 4p, we were told that our rooms weren't ready yet, so we decided to have lunch in the onsite restaurant, the Blue Wave. It was pretty good for a hotel restaurant. We sat outdoors in the patio area under tables with umbrellas, which helped to suggest an island feel. The windows looking out at the marina could have been a little cleaner (had smudges) but the food was good (my husband and daughter had the blackened Mahi Mahi, I had the fish tacos and my son had the french dip sandwich). After we were done, one of our rooms was ready, so we proceeded to head down. Warning: if you have a lot of luggage, ask them if they could drive you with the little carts, it's quite a walk, especially if you've been hoofing it around Disneyland for 5 days like we just did! We had 2 rooms there, one for our teenagers (which was a godsend!) and ours overlooked the marina. I already described the room above. Overall: Very nice property~relaxing, tiki torches at night, little babbling "waterfall" in lobby, nice staff. Right next door is Humphreys on the Bay which also has outdoor concerts. While we were there, Jackson Browne played one night and then America. Good location if you have a car. A little far to walk to restaurants that are "nearby" but about 15-20 minutes will get you there. We were only there for 2.5 days, so it was ok for us. We didnt rent a car, but did the Old Town trolley tour one day, and they will pick you up and drop you off right outside the hotel, so it worked out nicely. I highly recommend it. We loved Coronado Island/the Hotel Del/and the beach was excellent! The other times we left we took a cab, it was about $20 one way to downtown (went shopping at Horton Plaza with the teens the first day) and then about the same to get to Seaworld the following day. Not sure if we would stay there again, not hesitating because of any bad experience, just like to try new hotels. I would have liked to use the pools, hot tub, bikes and just relax more at the property, we did the Old Town tour one day and then Seaworld the next and then we left, so If you are going to go, please use and enjoy the property more than we did! If you can, try and stay at the new building! FYI, if you are a light sleeper, the walls are paper thin, there were people partying next door one night, and we could hear their conversations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: jcanderson
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was one of the best Best Westerns we have ever stayed in. Great rooms. Nice Pool. Clean and very friendly. No free breakfast but the breakfast in the hotel was great Stay and eat in the hotel. Do not go to the Brunch at Bali Hai..down the street. Very over priced restaraunt for the food that was served needs redone. Bathrooms..not good

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a Keeper, Incredible Views, Incredible Location, Nice Amenities, Fantistic Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanDieg0Trip
Reviews.Content: Let me preface my comments by first saying I am very picky when it comes to hotels. This property is actually the combination of two hotels. Casa del Mar is seemingly the newer hotel of the two. I believe Casa del Mar is mostly the suites. We did not stay in Casa del Mar, we stayed in the Island Palms, adjacent property. I believe both hotels operate under the name of Island Palms Best Western. I would stay here again but in Casa del Mar. The Island Palms facility itself is older, beautiful with its mature trees and shade however our room smelled moldy, there were ants in the room, the beds are quite small and very low. The rooms were tight, a little dark. I believe these comments were comments others have written as well so no real surprises. Having said that it is just a room to sleep in and overall it was clean, I found it acceptable, but just above my cutoff line of what is 'clean' for a hotel. I walked through Casa del Mar just to check it out, it is definitely much cleaner, brighter, larger rooms, seemingly much newer, etc. Oddly enough I believe the prices are comparable which I don't understand since Casa del Mar seemed at least 2 steps above the standard Island Palms rooms. I would recommned you stay in Cas del Mar. The LOCATION of this property is AMAZING. It is incredible with just steps to a small beach on the marina, access to both pools at either hotel, steps to rent a kayak or go fishing, free bike riding. We traveled to San Diego for a wedding, our friends who booked at other hotels more out of town to save money were quite jealous. They paid as much as us or more and didn't get half the hotel and sacrificed location. I would go so far to say that if you are there with your family you could almost never have to get in the car and go anywhere else, something for everyone right there. The rates were incredibly low for such a tremendous location, what a steal! Parking is completely FREE, did I mention FREE? Internet is completely FREE (now that is definitely not found often). There is an on-site washer/dryer you can use for a nominal cost of like $1.00 per load, fabulous if you there with family like we were. Bikes are complimentary at the hotel. Kayking just across the street is something like $20 per 2 hours, another great steal. The two pools are great, the Island Palms with more ambience and an outdoor bar, Casa del mar more modern with a nice fireplace outdoors. Next time I would definitely rent a junior suite in Casa Del Mar, I think definitely worth the additional costs and there really simply is no better location. I peaked in on a suite in the Casa Del Mar and it looked fabulous. Most anything on the Marina side has an incredible view, make sure you book a room on the Marina side no matter which hotel you are at. Every room on the marina side of Casa Del Mar had a private little patio. The Island Palms rooms only the large rooms had patios, ours just a chair with a little lawn, still very nice to just step right outside and view the beautiful marina and the boats, the water, etc. The hotel is secluded making you feel like you are on an island yet it is just minutes and I mean minutes to just about everything you want to see in San Diego. I checked out the other hotels while I was there that I had looked at online before my travels, they just don't compare, much more commercialized areas with tons of people and traffic. Island Palms is difficult to explain and the photos don't do it justice, but the VIEWS are just INCREDIBLE. Humphrey's, adjacent to the Best Western, looks nice to stay at also. I believe all are owned by the same developer who appears to be snatching up all the properties on Shelter Island. Humphreys has outdoor concerns which you could hear lightly down the street, if you're younger you might enjoy staying there and listening to the concerts. Insider Tip: A local told us about SUNSET CLIFFS ... DEFINITELY worth the trip. Sunset Cliffs is an incredible view of the ocean, the views watching the sunset are breathtaking, again, words don't do it justice. Sunset Cliffs is also great just to look at the beautiful homes, have a picnic, walks some trails (its a public park). We watched locals propel themselves down the cliffs to the small private beach and surf in, while the sun sets, really incredible. We definitely hope to go back and will definitely stay on Shelter Island.

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigTTTTT
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a queen suite- like a small apartment, very convenient and pretty good value for this area. Pool area is nice though was pretty crowded during our stay. The hotel is not really close to any attractions but is centrally located so its not hard to drive to wherever you might want to go in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location and value”
Reviews.Author: dave_cwiklinski
Reviews.Content: My wife and 18-month old daughter stayed here on our vacation from July 29 through August 2 and could not have been more impressed with the hotel. First off, the location was centrally located and was an easy starting point for our day trips that included SeaWorld, The San Diego Zoo, Petco Park, Old Town and the coastal beach towns. We did not eat at the restaurant on site, but did have room service and the food was wonderful and well-portioned. The pool was nice and the tiki-bar was a nice touch. Best of all was being close to the Marina and Harbor and the "walkability" of the shoreline. Many night we took a nice walk along the shore to see the boats and skyline as a way to ease our daughter into bedtime and it was perfect. I am not sure when I will be lucky enough to get to San Diego again, but when I do I hope this hotel is still around as I'd stay here again in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, Holiday Inn at Bayside is better”
Reviews.Author: socaltraveler45
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 1 year anniversary. Proposes a good value ($140 per night is decent), and guest services were great, but housekeeping left our door ajar when we were out (with pearl necklaces in the room) and a/c didn't work very well. The parking lot was not large enough for the amount of guests that were there, and the ice machine was turned off when we got there, leaving us to wait for them to turn it on, and then even longer for the machine to function. Also, when we got there the room was HOT, no one had turned the a/c on prior to our arrival. At the end of the weekend, with headaches due to cheap pillows, we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: arvizu9618
Reviews.Content: No complaints other than disappointed pool was closed in the newer area, but that's the cost of progress. Very Central location, close to everything you want to see and do in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Great bar, good location, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: kjcvictoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon. The guy at the front desk was a bit textbook. We checked in then came back 10 minutes later to ask for a recommendation for dinner and he looked at us and said "Hi, how can I help you?" like he had never seen us before. It was just after 9 pm and he said that everything was closed and there was only fast food up on Rosecranz. We had McDonalds, it worked, but he wasn't very impressive. The casa del mar room was pretty nice, good view of the Bay, but right by the noisy door. Found two hairs on two different towels, ick. The rest of the room was very clean and spacious, though there were a few marks on the walls and door jambs, but not too bad. Decent location for driving to Old Town, Seaworld and the Zoo, about 10-15 minutes each. Nice walk along Shelter Island. THE BEST PART: The bar. Shout out to Julio - great bartender, friendly and attentive. Can't beat the happy hours - Tuesdays $2.50 margaritas (very good!) and 2 filling fish tacos for $3.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: GoMrB
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 1/2 year old daughter, and and I toodk a trip to San Diego to go to Sea World the following day. Our stay could not have been more perfect. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms Director escorted us personally to our room, and the GM went out of his way to wish us well. We ended up having dinner at the hotel restuarant: what a beautiful vule of the marina. My wife said her chicken was excellent and the salmon I trreated mslef too was perfectly basted with a mustard honey glaze. Our room was not only very modern and had been upgraded with 42 inch flat screen TV, but our private balcony overlooked some spectacular scenery of the marina. This hotel is a gem to Shelter Island and rivals much bigger, well know hotels in the downtown area. I will not stay anywhere else but the Best Western Island Palms the next time I'm in San Diego. I hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For The Price!”
Reviews.Author: IM_Bogeyman
Reviews.Content: We statyed in Queen Jr Suite on 2nd floor with a view facing the bay / downtown. The room was exceptionally clean. The furnishings were decent with plenty of room to move around. The location of the hotel is fantastic if you're in SD to be a tourist. We visited Sea World, SD Zoo, USS MIdway, Ocean Beach, & La Jolla. All were in easy driving distance. The restaurant ("Blue Wave") has a nice breakfast menu. The dinner menu was very good and satisfied our varying tastes (including my vegetarian daughter). The highlight of the property has to be the staff. The men / women at the front desk were the best we've ever encountered. From check in / check out to directions to restaurant recommendations: these people were very helpful. Ever single staff member went out of their way to greet us (even the non-English speaking ones) regardless of the time of day. We've been to a number of hotels that would be considered "nicer" in terms of quality of the property but the staff win the contest hands down. Great job to Island Palms! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Shelter Island Value”
Reviews.Author: hleigh19
Reviews.Content: We've stayed on Shelter Island several times at Humphrey's, but traveling during the peak season, on a weekend, decided to go with the better deal down the road at the Island Palms. It was a great decision! Our room was in the Casa Del Mar building, which is still not quite renovated, but the rooms were clean and well-appointed and construction noise was not a problem. The "pool" attached to this building was not completed and looks like it will be pretty small when it's done, but the hotel's main pool is very nice. We only had breakfast at the restuarant, but the food was good and not too pricey. The lounge/bar is tiny, but the bartenders were wonderful and are happy to put something in plastic so it can be taken down to the pool after the pool bar closes. Being a little farther down the island from Humphrey's, even our Bayside room did not get too much street noise from weekend concert goers (of course, we're night owls, so we wouldn't notice noise until after 11:00) The staff was incredibly curteous and warm. The parking lot is kind of tight, so if you have a large vehicle you may have some trouble, but in our small SUV it was fine. We would certainly stay here again, but might try to get a room in the main building as opposed to Casa Del Mar, at least until the renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: produceguy
Reviews.Content: hotel section where we stayed was under construction, the pool was closed, the ice machine was moved so you had to go upstairs to find ice, the garage was closed, so cars were all over the lot hard to maneuver . we were on the first floor and couldn't get the curtain to close completely, so had to put a chair in front of the window to hold them closed. Ate once in the restaurant and found the waiter to be indifferent, food was just o.k., next day ate at the hotel next door and had a greast meal and enjoyed the waiter.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay... Close to Mission Beach & Downtown. Safe and Nice”
Reviews.Author: theshovers
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a Best Western before and they were OK. This hotel was absolutely wonderful. The staff in the resturant were excellent and so was the food. The hotel grounds were kept very well, beautiful views, clean room etc. Housekeeping was fantastic, trustworthy and friendly. The entire staff from check in to check out was great. My 11 year old son LOVED the pool and spa. The food in the resturant was excellent as well. This was my first trip to Shelter Island & B.W. Island Palms Inn but it won't be my last. Any time I make a trip to San Diego, I will be staying here. Thank you for the great time Best Western!!! Kudos to all of your staff,.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location - Shelter Island”
Reviews.Author: herbieBme
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the B/W Island Palms located on Shelter Island. The front desk crew was out of sight. They couldn't do enough for us. The room was very clean with a very comfy king bed. Frig keep the wine chilled. Even had a small balcony where we could sit and watch the people at the harbor. Excellent view from our upstairs room. Would stay again next time in S.D. Several Restaurants within walking distance. Had a great Bfast in the restaurant and stopped by the lounge for an evening drink.

Reviews.Title: “Your Best Choice on Shelter Island”
Reviews.Author: OCtravel_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel many times. It is by far the best Best Western I've ever encountered. The staff is fantastic, the restaurant is great, and the prices are reasonable. You can't beat the location and they have their own Marina. I do not like the fact that the hotel and marina do not package rooms and boat slips together. The marina prices for transient slips are very high. $60.00 a day for a 26 foot boat. They even have a pool bar.....when's the last time you saw that at a Best Western? My only complaint for this trip is the low quality pool towels. They are only big enough for a small child. Island Palms, if you're reading this, spring for some decent pool towels! Rooms are very clean and the new side of the hotel can compete with the local Marriot for quality and decor. This is the place you want to stay if you are planning on going to a concert at Humphrey's. You don't have to worry about parking, and you can walk to the concert in just a couple of minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and excellently maintained.”
Reviews.Author: 3hapitravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our last 2 nights in San Diego and were very pleased with the beautiful location. Our room faced the bay and the view was wonderful. The room was very nicely decorated and impeccably clean. We didn't have a chance to use the pool, but it looked very nice and inviting. The price we paid for the room was a great value and we got more than we expected for our money. If we come back to San Diego we would make this hotel our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: britromancer
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were very pleased with this hotel. The room was very nice, comfortable and spacious. We had a great view from the balcony. We also took advantage of the free bike rentals. All in all, a grat place to stay at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: dpmiss
Reviews.Content: After many stays in San Diego, we happened upon the Island Palms. The location was perfect. Looking out over the marina with a freshly brewed cup of coffee was a delight. Our room was twice the size of a regular hotel room for the same price. Grounds were well manicured, pool area was great. Weather was blustery, June gloom, but the pool was at least 80 degrees and the spa over 100. Staff was very accomodating in every way. For the price, you can't beat staying at this hotel. It is well worth the money. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean...definetly a keeper!”
Reviews.Author: LosAngeles2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Island Palms over Memorial Day weekend 2009. We reserved a junior suite and stayed in the Casa Del Mar Building in room 506 with 2 queen beds. The room was clean and exactly as described on the website. It was extremely spacious with a pretty big (long) balcony. Our balcony directly faced a new Island Palms building being remodeled but off to the left was a great view of the bay and to the right a small view of the boats. I wish it was more clear on their website that the wet bar includes plates, bowls, forks, spoons, cups, etc so that I could have brought oatmeal, cereal, etc for our 2 year old daughter but I'm mentioning it now so that it might help someone else. This room also has a small refrigerator and a complimentary in-room safe. The Casa Del Mar building is situated right across the street from a pier where many people fish (so don't forget your fishing poles if you want to take a stab at catching a mackerel or two!) and right across from a children's playground which we spent quite a few hours at. The hotel is about a 7 minute drive to Sea World up Nimitz Street. Because of the close proximity, we were able to bring our daughter back to the hotel for a nap during our all-day visit to Sea World. Super convenient and great location! The Casa Del Mar pool is currently closed for renovations. The main pool and jacuzzi off the lobby was open and was super busy with allot of children. It was fine for us since our 2 year old loved all of the other children but if you are looking for a quiet, romantic pool - this is probably not the place for you or at least it was not the place on Memorial Day weekend. Overall our stay was great. There was one thing that bothered me - the walls were thin thus the 4 star overall and room rating (=very good, not excellent). One of our neighbors was so loud - they had the TV blasting at night, I could hear their conversations, etc. Luckily my daughter and husband slept right thru it! I think this was an isolated incident because I never heard a peep from the neighbor on the other side of us or anyone else in this building. But beware that the walls in the Casa Del Mar building are thin and if you get unlucky enough to have inconsiderate people next to you, you will hear them. Also, FYI the parking is not great. They have limited spaces available on the property and if you get back late you might not find a space and have to park across the street at the park, which the hotel said is okay - a little inconvenient but not a big deal. This hotel is very nice and I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Parking problem”
Reviews.Author: ladybug1028
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at this hotel. We stay on the marina side and have a little patio that is wonderful. The ducks come and say Hi. The room is a suite with a kitchen without an oven. The living room area is small but comfortable and has a beautiful view of the marina. The problem appeared when we decided to go out Sunday evening to the harbor excursion dinner cruise on the bay with my ister and brother-in-law. We returned at 10:30pm and there was no parking. My husband went and spoke to the front desk and was told that there was construction ( not in the parking lot that). He was also told that parking was a courtresy/complimentary ( then why give each vehicle a Guest parking permit)nad that there was no one there to check permits. We had to park in the public parking area across the street.

Reviews.Title: “The price was right, location was good, surrounding construction a pain..”
Reviews.Author: TravelTrails
Reviews.Content: This was to be a special family event for my granddaughter's 4th birthday. Their online concierge request to help out was completely ignored and I had to book things from scratch after we arrived. The Villa 2 bedroom suites are very roomy which was great for our stay, however bedroom 2 had no closet. Only 2 light switches worked, top and bottom of the stairs only. Outside patio/balcony lites we on a dusk to dawn setting, so it was bright all nite until we unscrewed the bulbs. Our view out the back was green plastic netting instead of the marina, and even the small amount of grounds between our room and the netting was not maintained. One pool and spa were closed. Construction was the reason for all of this and none of this is mentioned on their web site. I have been to several hotels that had always stated online that they had construction projects pending and where and to be prepared. Then, we were not allowed to check-in until 4P on the dot....as were some other folks that we met up with strolling the park across the street. We were there at 3 and had hoped to allow the little one some time for rest before the evening, but alas, that was not to be. The next day our room did not get cleaned as they didn't come around until late in the afternoon and our little one was taking her afternoon nap and could not be disturbed. In a family villa I would think this would be a consideration in the cleaning schedule. The next day I personally requested the cleaning staff to clean "in the morning" while we were gone. We did appreciate the 2 bedrooms and 3 full bathrooms. The couch downstairs made into a bed also so the full bathroom on the first floor would accommodate more guests if you needed to. San Diego is a great place to spend a weekend and we would like to return, however I will think long and hard before going back to Island Palms before construction is completed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places we've stayed!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: redsox721
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 25th anniversary trip to San Digeo. The Best Western Island Palms is amazing. We loved it. The room was beautiful. It was large and clean with comfortable beds. We were in a lovely corner room. "Thanks Shilo." We had a balcony from which we could see the marina and the bay. We also had a large window that gave us a full view of the bay. We could watch the small boats and an occasional cruise ship. The grounds and lobby were beautiful also. There is a nice area across the street with a lovely path to walk on. The marina is on the other side of the hotel and is nice to watch the boats. We arrived at the hotel after a long day of flying from the east coast and driving from Los Angeles. Both of us were tired but hungry. The restaurant staff was wonderful in having our food order placed in to go boxes. They even supplied us with wonderful bread and utensils. They definitely went above and beyond to make us feel special. This was the feeling from the entire staff. They are very friendly and willing to do what it takes to make your stay special. The food was delicious. We had breakfast in the restaurant. The food again was delicious. We had a table by the window and was amazed at the view. We didn't go in the pool but did it looked wonderful. The hotel is close to the airport, zoo and other attractions. We will definitely plan to make another trip back to the BW Island Palms.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be my first choice if coming back to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Town_Country
Reviews.Content: When entering the room, there was a mildew, old & wet smell to the place. The place is a typical Best Western motel but with more square footage. The living room is pretty small and the tv is old. Everything about the place looked pretty worn, except for the restroom in the bedroom. Looks like they just renovated the restroom. I have to give them 5 stars for that. That was pretty much the only thing I liked about the room. The bed was ok. Nothing to rave about. The room does come with a full kitchen with all of the amenities and cookwares. The view on the marina side was not that great and the water was dirty. The bay side was alot nicer. I am annoyed at the fact that there's not enough parking spaces available. If you don't get back early enough, you will lose out on parking. You will have to park across the street, which isn't that bad, but still it's across the street. Like I mentioned, this wouldn't be my first choice if I came back to San Diego. But it's cozy enough to spend a weekend and it's pretty close to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay at the Island Palms again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: gordonsvillegal
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel off the beaten path in a quiet location. You need to rent a car to get around San Diego from here . The shuttle concierge will arrange one for you and you can drop it off at the hotel. They have a free shuttle to the airiport. We loved the harbor on one side and the bay on the other. There are multiple good restaurants on Shelter Island, including Miguel's and the Bali Hai. The decor is updated--textured neutrals. The whole place is clean as a whistle and the staff works hard to keep it that way. They even wash the plants in the lobby! The staff was knowledgeable, friendly, and competent. Not one surly one in the bunch. The hotel restaurant food was okay-we only had breakfast and that only once, but it turns out they have excellent $4.00 Bloody Mary's on Sunday mornings! The pool is heated, the hot tub was great. They have a couple of bikes you can borrow for free to ride up and down the island. I loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great location, and knowledgeable and courteous staff!”
Reviews.Author: mcmeeks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Island Palms for 3 nights. The hotel is surrounded by water to the east and west so you are just about guaranteed to have an ocean view. I stayed in a suite that had a balcony, kitchen, and separate bedroom which was great since my mother-in-law was with us. The balcony, where we spent a lot of time, was very private compared to the hotels where the balconies line the entire building. We had an ocean view in both directions which was also great for the 95 degree day - we had a great breeze coming right across our balcony/room all day! The staff were incredible and the hotel has a great restaurant, pool, and bar. There are a ton of great restaurants right in the area and Humphrey's by the Bay is right next door if you want to catch a concert. All in all, my expectations were far exceeded by the Island Palms and its wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again but,”
Reviews.Author: cmassi
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviews have stated the Rv's block the bay view you are paying for. The front desk just said "they just passed a law they cannot park there. " Well they are still there. Get a second floor room or donot pay for view. They should also offer a contenental breakfast. A plus is no parking fee. Staff friendly, rooms are nice. One of the better hotels we stayed during our 2 wk travel through California.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best vacations ever!”
Reviews.Author: 12_string098
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 weeks to get away from a very long Massachusetts winter. The hotel is on an island with a waterway in front and a marina in the back. Our room had a table so we could play cards eat etc. with the water view. The only thing negative at all is the light was a little dim in the room. The staff is very friendly & helpful. They were always willing to recommend restaurants and gave us coupons to the many attractions that San Diego has to offer. They let us use beach bikes to explore the island. There is little or no traffic there and a trail that is on the other side of the marina. It was a great vacation! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you know what you are getting.”
Reviews.Author: par41
Reviews.Content: We booked a room, king size room with a view of the bay. Sure we got a view of the bay on ground level, but RV homes parked across the street blocked our view. Our room was not like the pictures and discription on the web site. The room was small for the money we paid, My husband was here for a conference, so I came along to enjoy the view, not a very good one from the room at least. I recommend this place only if you know what kind of room you are getting, talk to the hotel before booking. Phyllis

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, great suite and great visit! Will return soon!”
Reviews.Author: BeadedScorpion
Reviews.Content: Stayed in king bed, 2-room suite for a recent 2-week business trip. Suite was always clean and the kitchen was such a great extra! Great room service from Blue Wave Rest. on-site. Beautiful scenery looking over the bay. Easy and fast route from the airport and rental car locations. Safe parking. Great shopping and this hotel is close to Sea World. Numerous casinos surround San Diego. The only critical comment I passed on was that the shower was EXTREMELY low pressure and the water had to run almost 5 minutes until hot water came out. Not too good when you're trying to conserve water. Additionally, I used my Entertainment Card to get a discount on the rate for the suite. Already planning next visit within a couple of months!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: s.d.granny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Island Palms for a much needed vacation. We were upgrade to a lovely suite. The view of the marina was beautiful. We enjoyed a daily visit by the resident Mallard Ducks. Our housekeeper did a great job of cleaning our rooms. Everything was spotless. The front desk staff was very helpful. This property deserves a top rating. It is very well managed.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Mainer44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in mid February for 3 nights and loved every minute of it. The clerk at the front desk upgraded us to a room that faced directly onto the marina and it was wonderful. Our front door was about 15 feet from the water and the view was amazing. We could see all kinds of boats docked at the marina. The pool area also faced the marina, and it was nice to relax while looking at the view. The pool itself was very nice and well-kept. The week we were there was in the 60's, so it was nice to have a pool that was heated. I could actually see the steam rising off the surface of the pool. Another thing I enjoyed about the hotel was the location. We were able to get to all the the San Diego attractions within minutes, yet being out on Shelter Island, we felt secluded from the rest of the city. If I ever came back to San Diego, I would definitely think of staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice placeto stay.....make sure you have a car”
Reviews.Author: joisey-joe
Reviews.Content: this hotel was very nice, got it at a reasonable price and pick up at the airport & drop off at the cruise terminal was perfect...... no problems with the hotel at all - staff even helped us find a good medical walk-in clinic for a minor problem my only caveat is that there is not much in the area, you can walk to......and cabs are expensive, so if you want to see anything in san diego - make sure you have a car .... everything is close by, but like i said the cab rides added up

Reviews.Title: “Completely full - yet incredibly quiet”
Reviews.Author: meadowblazingstar
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Diego. We were looking for a suite for our family vacation. We selected this hotel based on its location near the airport since we had an early flight out our last day. We appreciated that there was no additional fee for parking and that it was pretty close to most locations we wanted to visit. What amazed us was how quiet this facility was. When we shared our pleasure about that with the front desk staff, they said that they were completely full on at least one of the 5 nights of our stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed morning walks on the trail across the road alongside the bay. Our youngest child enjoyed a small park nearby. Lots of construction going on down near the building we stayed in as the hotel expands. Our building's pool was closed but there was another available to us at the main building. The circular staircase in our two level suite were a bit slippery for one of our kids in socks - but there are doors accessing the unit from both levels for bringing in suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere for a leadership retreat with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: ZamoraTraveler
Reviews.Content: The conference coordinator went above and beyond to be sure that our needs were met and that everything was in place when we arrived. The conference support staff were so pleasant and efficient. They went out of their way to make us comfortable and be sure we had everything we needed even if we hadn't thought of it in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: greg117
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights on visit to San Diego. Parking is limited and is definitely at a premium in the evening. Ongoing construction obstructed the view from my first floor room. Otherwise, my stay at the Palms was a most pleasant experience. The "island" is a great place to walk and provides a lovely view of Coronado and downtown. It is convenient to everything. Did not try the restaurant, and the pool was closed for construction. Small but adequate exercise room. There is a computer with free internet access in lobby. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome!”
Reviews.Author: gokris
Reviews.Content: This place was great! We booked 3 nights and added on a 4th night because we liked it so much. The staff was great, very friendly and helpful. The property is beautiful, overlooking the water and in a very safe location which was important to us because we had our kids with us. Our room was amazing, it was a mini suite with a kitchenette overlooking the water with a patio. There was a bedroom with seperate living room, it even had a pull out sofa bed which we didn't even realize until the 2nd day, that was a plus with the kids. We only paid $89 a night which was a great deal, I think they must be slow because their regular rate is much higher. Overall, it was just a great stay and we would stay there again anytime we go to SD. My few complaints: our remote didn't work and even changing the chanel on the t.v itself didn't work most of the time, maintenance came up but only brought a new remote that didn't fix the problem, but they were very friendly. Also, room service went ahead and charged an 18% tip without telling us so we ended up tipping an extra $5 on top of it. The food was ok and kind of expensive, I would not really recommend it, but what can you expect from room service? They also had another guest with the same name as my husband and ended up mixing up our 2 reservations with caused some problems with the keys, but they tried to fix it right away.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: DeathLlama
Reviews.Content: Holy cow! This is REALLY nice. We checked in earlier today and they upgraded us to a mini suite (we only booked for a double). Check in staff was quick and very cordial. I booked at the Best Western web site for the AAA rate of $89 a night. This seriously feels like a steal. Maybe they're not too busy with a sluggish economy and all, but still, I'm surprised at how nice it is considering how little we're paying. Our suite has a patio with a view of the water. We've got a kitchenette. The only complaint I have is that the fold-out bed/couch has quite a slope to it, but our toddler doesn't seem to care/notice. We are very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Bay View Vacation”
Reviews.Author: DJTravelBoy
Reviews.Content: I booked my seven nights via an Expedia package (air/car/hotel). The Island Palms is located ideally on Shelter Island near the airport but far enough away to avoid any traffic or noise associated with it. I was 'upgraded' to a second floor room that looked out on the Bay. Staff was very friendly and helpful when needed. I would book this hotel again in a second. Free parking and free wi-fi sealed the deal. Also, Miguel's Cantina is located just near the turn onto Shelter Island. I'm a native San Diegan and Miguel's is one of the finest value restaurants in town, especially for lovers of Mexican food. The new Liberty Station development is less than a five minute drive from the hotel with lots of restaurant and grocery options.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: maggs01
Reviews.Content: I tagged on a weekend in San Diego after spending time in Tijuana on business - not so familiar with San Diego having only ever stayed for a one night layover on a previous holiday - Trip advisor reviews looked pretty good so booked based on that . I loved the location - directly on the bay. I got to see cruise liners and military ships just meters off the shoreline. Staff at BW Island Palms went above and beyond their duties and as a single female traveller they offered lots of advice and ideas. Stayed in the Casa Del Mar building - was a little dated but clean and comfortable beds. I had room service one evening from the hotel restaurant which was really good and pretty reasonable. After this trip will very much consider San Diego as a holiday destination in the future

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: love2seenewthings
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Island Palms was a great place to stay while visiting San Diego. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The entire staff were very friendly and welcoming. Staying on Shelter Island was perfect it was quiet and out of the hustle and bustle of downtown, yet it is only minutes away from all the attractions, zoo, seaport village, etc.. The Blue Wave restaurant had a good variety of choices for both breakfast and dinner. The food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the BW Island Palms!!”
Reviews.Author: SUN2006Illinois
Reviews.Content: It was a short visit but we thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it! We were looking for a nice place to stay for one night pre-cruise out of San Diego and we definitely picked a winner. We had never been to San Diego (or California) so I was looking for a location that would be convenient to the port but still give us a nice feel of the city. The hotel had a wonderful shuttle service that picked us up at the airport. The driver was very prompt and friendly and pointed out highlights on the short trip (3mi?) to the hotel. Check-in was quick and easy and the staff made us feel truly welcome. (They actually treat you with yummy, fresh baked cookies in the afternoon.) Our room was cozy and clean and we had a great water view right out our door. It was mid afternoon so we walked around to investigate the place and stopped in the bar for a drink and an appetizer. Great food and the bartender was very nice. He was a local and was able to answer any questions we had. He highly recommended the hotel restaurant so later that evening we had a delicious meal right there at the hotel. The next morning we went for a nice long walk around the "island" and then headed back to check-out and head for the ship. Again, the shuttle was there to take us to the cruise port. Thanks so much to the wonderful staff at the Best Western Island Palms for making our first taste of San Diego and southern California so pleasant! We look forward to going back someday soon and spending more time in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view and great stay”
Reviews.Author: kaiyama
Reviews.Content: We stayed clean large room with kitchen. The room is yacht harbor view and everything is good. One minus point is, the room we stayed was 2nd floor but there are no elevator. Other than that, I was 100% satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugSoCal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just before Thanksgiving. Lovely vacation! Cons: Military helicopters were doing training, so we heard a lot of chopper noise (nothing that the hotel had control over, though). Pros: The staff was awesome; very friendly, helpful and accomodating. We took advantage of the "free bike" rentals. Nice bikes, beautiful area to ride around, and a great family activity. Based on other reviews from Tripadvisor, we got the Junior Suite and were absolutely pleased with this room. It had tons of space, lovely decor and everything was clean and worked properly. We had a 2nd floor waterview room. We were on the harbor side. Pluses are that we got to see all the ships coming in and out (including the "Ronald Reagan" aircraft carrier - all the armed forces men and women were lined up on the deck, coming home for Thanksgiving - it was very touching). Minuses were the noise level on this side. The bayside would probably be quieter, but then we wouldn't have gotten to see the ship traffic :) The fitness room was nice, too. All new equipment, very nice. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here -- for a feeling of small-town San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: Bagan
Reviews.Content: We're frequent visitors to San Diego, and we make a habit of staying at Island Palms. It's often said that San Diego hasn't realized it's a small town that grew into a big city. Staying at this hotel evokes a feeling of San Diego as it used to be. Located on Shelter Island, the hotel is isolated from the rampant development, freeways and mall jams that characterize the more high-profile neighborhoods. Yet it is convenient to all that. But on Shelter Island you're surrounded by shops, restaurants and homes that don't seem to have changed much in the past 20 or 30 years. You're in the middle of the "yachtie" subculture, a different little world. The pace is slower and the view is superb. It's worth the extra price to get a "Bayview Suite" on the 2nd floor facing the harbor (not the marina). Bring binoculars and amuse yourself from your deck, living room or bed with an unobstructed view of the fascinating boat traffic in the channel. You'll see everything from massive U.S. Navy vessels and cruise ships to tourist "duck" boats and fishing boats plus pleasure boats arriving in the U.S. from Mexico. A lovely green park runs alongside the channel -- perfect place for a picnic or a brisk morning walk. Or go to the other side of the hotel, with rows and rows of yachts in the marina, to watch boat crews busily taking care of the rich people's playthings. The suite is comfortable, with ceiling fans, vaulted bedroom ceiling and a kitchen that makes it feel more like home. The rooms were redecorated enough years ago t be a bit dated now. But that wall of windows overlooking the channel can't be beat. We travel a lot and know there are fancier, more exotic places to land. But Island Palms is still one of our favorite destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Weeklong Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rob24
Reviews.Content: My boyfirend & I just returned from our stay in San Diego. We spent the entire week at the Island Palms - great choice (thanks to TripAdvisor reviews!). We booked a bay view room (I know everyone recommends the marina view, but it was just a boring view of moored boats & a hill covered with homes - probably a little quieter). Our room was in the Casa del Mar building on the second floor. We had a private balcony with views of the harbor - cruise ships, fishing boats, navy ships (say a destroyer pass by just about every day), a fishing pier. You heard regular noise from Navy helicopters and jets taking off, but it was not overwhelming at all. If you are on the lower level of the Casa del Mar, you will get a lovely view of the parking lot, but the water is just across the street. The room was very clean and comfortable - couldn't ask for more. A functioning air conditioner and ceiling fan, plus plenty of toiletries and towels. The sink was separate from the toilet & tub/shower which was nice. There was a coffee maker and refrigerator, a desk with internet hookup, and a very comfortable chair along with our king sized bed. We always found the room clean and refreshed upon returning every evening. The windows also cranked open (after shifting the chairs around that were on the patio). I found this to be a very quiet, secluded hotel. You seemed to be away from it all on Shelter Island, but were within a 10-15 minute drive to everything (Zoo, Sea World, Balboa Park, Embarcadero, Mission Beach, La Jolla, Gaslamp area) - even supermarkets, drug stores, gas stations and Target were within 15 minutes driving. Staff was all super friendly. Pool & hot tub were wonderful and quiet (we used the second smaller pool and hot tub behind the Casa del Mar building). Later in the day, there weren't any towels at the pool, so bring your own from your room. There was a computer near the hotel's restaurant for internet use, so we were able to print our boarding passes before leaving. Exercise room was small but adequate (we didn't use it - just stuck our heads in). Hotel restaurat was decent, but we found much better food within walking distance. Across from the hotel is a waterfront park with a boat launch, public fishing pier, playground, and walkway. It was very nice to stroll along the water each night, and I never felt uncomfortable or unsafe. We had a small incident late in the week where the boiler in our building went down. We were lucky that we had gotten up early enough to get a lukewarm shower. We immediately contacted the front desk, and before we had left for the morning, a gentleman stopped by our room to let us know about the boiler and that they were working on it (we actually saw the workers arrive as we left the room - quick service!). I can't wait to get back to San Diego to stay here again. Our only complaint for the entire week - the parking is tight near the Casa Del Mar building on the weekends (Friday & Saturday night). A few larger pick-ups and SUVs had a difficult time maneuvering around. We were lucky that our rental car was a Toyota Corolla and could fit easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Daisy1009
Reviews.Content: Went to hotel for mid week getaway. Stayed in newer section. Second floor facing the bay. Great views of downtown San Diego and ships going in and out of harbor. Saw cruise ships and navy ships from large balcony. Mini suite with two queen beds, sitting area, and small kitchen area with microwave and sink. Room was great and service was exceptional. Location is great, very relaxed from the busy downtown. Took walks by bay every night. Make sure get 2nd floor if on the bay side. First floor ok but does look directly at parking lot. The marina side did seem quiet with nice views of boats, but we liked the action of watching the ships and boats and military helicopters. Stayed 3 nights and would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “It was alright.....”
Reviews.Author: TheBrewCity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Island Palms in mid-August. We paid a little extra for a room on the harbor side, which I recommend doing unless you want to spend your vacation staring at the parking lot. The location is great if you have a car, everything was 10-20 minutes away. The island the hotel is on (Shelter Island) has a nice bike/walking path on SD bay, the pool is great, and the restaurant was fair (a little pricey). The room was an average room it had a king bed with giant pillows, a microwave, and a very small seating area. The hotel staff at all levels was very friendly and accessible. Overall the hotel was nice, we enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: britsplatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Island Palms from 3rd to 9th September 2008 as part of a two week trip to the States, sandwiched between two city breaks (NYC and Chicago). We intended it to be our chillout part of the holiday and the hotel was just perfect for this in every respect. We had found the hotel online, but decided to call them direct to book. They were very helpful and even gave us good advice over a room - ie the bay view rooms do indeed look towards the bay, but between the room and the water is the hotel car park and a road and then a public car park before you see water! As a result, we took their recommendation (at a slightly higher rate admittedly) of a marina view room. This was perfect. We were in the two-storey (no lift) building at the far end of the hotel - I think it had recently been acquired and was originally another small hotel; the room was excellent and had clearly been renovated recently. The decor, carpets, bedding etc were high quality and immaculate. We had a huge king bed in a large room with a balcony (with chairs) that looked directly over the pool and the marina. There are two pools here - the main pool is very prettily landscaped with a hot -tub, toilets etc and right next to the bar/restaurant, but as a result was busier. We had the luxury, by opting for the smaller pool and hot tub outside our room, of having it to ourselves nearly every time we went there! The staff were amazing, from greeting us by name the minute we arrived to doing all they could for us. THe standard of housekeeping was top class. ALL staff were friendly and spoke when they passed you. We ate in both the restaurant and had bar meals and all were very good. Breakfast was particularly nice and also the meals were very reasonably priced for the location. Free bikes are available, which were made use of; there is a self service laundry too. We ate at the Red Sails Inn on Shelter Island and highly recommend it. Food and service excellent. We also ate at Humphreys next door - larger hotel with an excelelnt bar with live music and again a very good restaurant overlooking the marina. The Old Town trolley buses pick up twice in the morning and drop off twice at night outside the hotel. The shuttle bus (free) was also a plus. The airport is so close (but not intrusive noise wise) that the transfer was a doddle. We spent some time in San Diego - loved both Old Town and the Gaslamp quarter, and also Coronado Island. Wonderful place, fabulous weather every day... but cannot recommend the Island Palms enough as a location and hotel. Would return every year if we could afford to!

Reviews.Title: “Everyone is friendly in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: AngelAznLover
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. San Diego has the nicest people on the planet! Amanda was the girl who checked us in and we got upgraded to a 2 bedroom suit. And it was fabulous.I work for a hotel in Las Vegas myself but that was really good service. We even received a message from Amanda after we checked in, letting us know if we need anything just give them a call. I didn't know best western had a upscaled hotels like this. I'm going to stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Dteacher60
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 just returned from six nights at the BW Island Palms. Would we stay there again? Yes, but with some changes. First of all, our room was facing the bay on the first story. The bay is nice with sailboats, fishing boats, and naval ships passing by. The problem with the bay view is that we faced the hotel parking lot, 2-lane street, and public parking across the street. The same large motor homes blocked our view for days. My suggestion is to choose the view facing the marina--much quieter and prettier! Unfortunately, we had noisy neighbors. I had to call the front desk 3 nights for 3 different guests. One guest left his loud TV on; security had to shut the power to his room as he apparently was not in the room. Other guests were very noisy outside and inside (returning from partying late at night?). Security was always fairly quick to respond. The hotel staff was wonderful. They were helpful, courteous and friendly. Upon check-out they gave us a generous voucher for lunch to make up for the neighboring guests' loudness. Our room was clean, pleasantly appointed, and the beds/pillows were so comfortable! It was small for 4 people (2 adults and 2 teen daughters). The large size of the bathroom made up for it, however. Granite countertops, tile floors, stone lined shower--very, very nice! The pool and hot tub were very clean. Usually I won't go into a public hot tub, but we enjoyed it every evening. The location was PERFECT! Shelter Island is close to everything we did: airport, Cabrillo Nat'l. Monument, Zoo, Sea World, Coronado, ocean beaches, restaurants, the Rock Church on Rosencranz for Sunday service.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional experience with Island Palms”
Reviews.Author: AndiamoCC
Reviews.Content: Had my daughter's wedding at Island Palms and they could not have been more accomodating! All aspects were expertly attended to and Brianna (wedding coordinator) performed ALL of her duties with incredible aplomb and professionalism! Some of my family had rooms at the hotel and each of them raved about the attitude of the staff and the accomodations/location etc. Definitely recommend this place for functions and even for a little getaway in your own hometown. I live here in San Diego & would certainly consider such a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: 2manyjules
Reviews.Content: Our room was in the bridal glen and we had a spectacular view of the harbor! The room was basic but comfortable and the bathroom large. I thought the stand up shower (no tub) was a little dark but other than that, had no complaints. I loved that we had a mini fridge to store the beer and the windows & shutters opened up to a great view! We took lots of pictures of the million dollar yachts parked in the harbor and commented on how some had helicopters parked on top before changing and heading to the pool. The pool was very tropical with a nice hot tub and tikki bar (the piped in music was fun and I loved it when I heard an obscure U2 song being played). I thought it was interesting how they had plexi glass surrounding the area to cut back the wind factor. The hotel restaurant has average food and spotty service. Breakfast is not included in the room rate. Across from the hotel is a public beach where families enjoyed cooking out, bon fires and fishing off the pier. The owner of Sharkies (the pier bait shop) is very helpful and the colorful characters only enhanced the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay -- but get a Marina View”
Reviews.Author: JetsFan8
Reviews.Content: Our family of our four completed a two-week California vacation earlier this month by staying three nights at the Island Palms. We had a terrific stay. We had a junior suite, with two queen beds, in the newer Casa del Mar building on the second floor that provided a wonderful view of the marina. (My wife and I spent many early morning and late evening hours sitting on the balcony, enjoying the view.) The junior suite provided lots of space. The Island Palms has two swimming pools, with the larger and nicer pool connected to the main building; that pool also had a tiki bar with reasonably-priced drinks and good service. We ate a good and reasonably-priced breakfast at the hotel's restaurant. We also enjoyed the Shelter Island location; it provided a quiet respite from busier San Diego, but was easy driving distance to the Zoo and other attractions. A few notes: (1) the Casa del Mar building (a former hotel that was acquired by the Island Palms some years ago) looked newer and nicer than the other Island Palms building. I suspect that TA reviews that complained about small or older looking accommodations were not staying in the Casa del Mar. The junior suite in the Casa del Mar was pleasantly large; (2) inquire with the hotel if you care whether your room has a view of the bay or the marina. Island Palms' description of the rooms' views can be confusing (if not misleading). A busy public parking lot and a public street separate the hotel from the bay itself. If you want to view the bay, you must have a second floor room, which would enable you to see over the parking lot and road. These second floor rooms are called "water view" rooms. The first floor rooms facing the bay are called "bay view" rooms -- despite the fact that they will provide nothing more than view of the car parked in front of your room. Adding to the confusion is that "water view" rooms (in addition to describing second floor rooms facing the bay) also describe rooms facing the marina. I did not learn this terminology until shortly before we were scheduled to leave on our trip. We originally had a "bay view" room. After several conversations with the hotel, we managed to change our reservation to a marina view room -- which required a reservation for a "water view" room "facing the marina" (and not the bay). ( Hope that wasn't too confusing.) I don't think we would have enjoyed our stay nearly as much if we had a first floor view of the "bay." The marina view was tremendous. With that caveat, we would return to the Island Palms for future visits and would recommend the hotel to others. We had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on Marina side of hotel”
Reviews.Author: VacationStateofMind
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful views of marina, if you are fortunate enough to have a room on that side of the hotel. Friendly and professional service from staff. Good location near Interstate 5, Cabrillo monument, etc. Well maintained pool area, with towels and drinks. Free parking. Cons: No breakfast included, unlike most Best Western properties. Drab rooms, and small in size.

Reviews.Title: “Fireworks on Shelter island”
Reviews.Author: shingers
Reviews.Content: We arrived here towards the end of an east coast trip and were looking for a place to relax after a lot of traveling. We were not dissapointed. The hotel has its own marina on the city side and the harbour entrance on the ocean sde. The location could have been called peacefull apart from some airplane noise and the odd cruise ship/naval vesell foghorn. The pool was nice and the hot spa really hot, it did get a bit crowded but it was a holiday weekend. We only used the resteraunt for breakfast and these were great. The rooms were well appointed, beds comfortable, good bathroom though for some reason no lights in the shower which was a bit gloomy. Woke up on the Friday morning to find a tented village had sprung up overnight on the verges and other grassy areas by the sea, we had stumbled upon the best place to see the 4th July fireworks display. 5 locations co-ordinated a wonderfull display around the bay. Great location, nice rooms, good pool and food . would have loved to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Island Palms”
Reviews.Author: Team63
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel in the San Diego area to have some business meetings. We had used a hotel on Shelter Island before and wanted to stay in the general area. I contacted the hotel and talked to Chris Bartholamew. He met me one afternoon and showed me around the facility. He was most accommadating. The facilities were exactly what we needed for our meetings. Our stay in May of this year was very nice. The rooms, both meeting and sleeping were more than sufficient, very comfortable. I was pleasantly surprised by the resturant at the hotel. The menu was upscale, but affordable and the food was delicious. We have another meeting scheduled for September of this year and I'm sure the experience will be just as enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: chickidee6868
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of location to airport. Great property. Clean and very comfortable bed. Front desk staff very professional and helpful. Highly recommend! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “just lovely”
Reviews.Author: jessiow
Reviews.Content: wow what a lovely hotel, with lovely staff. We arrived for a 4 day stay,we had a great room and loved the quiet setting of shelter island. The location was fantastic, with plenty to do nearby. The staff were very helpful and printed us off directions and information about things we wanted to do. It was nice to stay somewhere so relaxing on such a hectic holiday. The hotel was clean and well managed and the setting was palm trees and blue skies.We loved the ducks and the beautiful birds in the gardens. Would love to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: tokyobrave
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were so nice that all that was missing was a Savannah Southern Accent and sweet tea or stronger. Man these people are nice. I was greeted by every single person with a "good Morning" "what a great day" "can I help you" by everyone from a gentleman driving a golf cart, to Eric at the pool to a housekeeper just passing by to Hank from the front desk. Awesome service. We needed extra cream for our in-room coffee and not only did we get a bag of cream but extra coffee - no charge and within minutes of asking. Hank called our room about 10 minutes after a no hassle early check in and asked if we needed anything and we asked for a couple more chairs to sit on the patio overlooking the marina - no problem in 10 minutes. Stayed with my 17, 16 and 8 year old daughters on spring break. 2 miles from Seaworld. 7 miles from Gaslamp/cruise ships. Great views, heated pool and hot tub overlooking the marina. Trader Joes is about 2 miles away - 2 buck Chuck at night overlooking the bay with a full moon and nice breeze.....sweet. Note that we - like many travelers here - have travelled the world and lived overseas, stayed at everything from Ritz Carlton in Osaka to well -no tell motels in Houston, so trust me when I say you will not be disappointed with this choice. EVERYTHING in this stay was completely hassle free, no worries and perfect.. We loved the 60's Scottsdale, AZ. /Beverly Hills look and feel. Everything was clean, manicured, well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: iammyshadow
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the hotel while my family visited the sights of San Diego. The hotel staff was very friendly. We traveled with 4 families 16 people total (7 children) The hotel was very child friendly. Each room had a kitchen which was great for breakfast. One day we had room service and it was priced good and was delicious. The best part was the location. We sat on the patio at night overlooking the harbor.
