The hotel was just 10 minutes from Sea World. We did stay in the "newer section" based on Trip Advisor recommendations. This was the perfect family vacation. We will come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay at the Island Palms”
Reviews.Author: slowolf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Island Palms for 3 nights while in town for our anniversary. We really liked the Shelter Island location as it was convenient to a lot of different attractions, yet was quiet and somewhat removed from the hustle and bustle of the city. The hotel backs up to the Shelter Island Marina, with the bay across the street. We stayed in the Casa del Mar building and had a standard room. The room was tiny and the King size bed and TV armoir took up the majority of the floor space. The furnishings in the room were somewhat dated. I was glad we had a balcony because the extra space was needed. The balcony had a nice view of the marina. The room was well equipped with a refrigerator, shampoo, lotions etc. The housekeeping was somewhat lax. When we returned at the end of each day, the bed was made, but looked like somebody had laid on it after making it. Also, the floor wasn't vacuumed.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: thatsmystuff
Reviews.Content: We finished a recent road trip at the Island Palms, and had a brilliant stay. The main consideration when looking for our San Diego hotel was parking and convenience as well as sea views, and we could hardly have chosen better. Our sea view was, in fact, a view of the bay and downtown on the other side, and we loved it. The island location means there is no through traffic, and we very much enjoyed the shore walks. The adjacent neighbourhood of Point Loma has plenty of small restaurants, and is just about at walking distance, too. The airport, Zoo, SeaWorld, and downtown are all mere minutes away by car (5-10 minutes to the airport, 15 to downtown and the Zoo). There are construction works going on at the far end of the hotel, so be sure to check that these are not going to be disturbing you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: LM_Mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Island Palms for a family vacation with our toddler. We had a promotional upgrade to a junior suite, which was great for us since it had a refrigerator and microwave, along with plates and utensils, very convenient for eating in the room. The staff were all very friendly and helpful -- the waitress at the hotel restaurant was particularly accomodating towards our daughter, bringing her stickers, suggesting things she might like to eat that were not on the menu, etc. Everything was very clean and comfortable and quiet. Our room looked over the parking lot (with a bit of a view of the marina to the sides) but was still quiet. I liked the location a lot -- not right in the middle of too much activity, but easy to get to places by car. There is a park with picnic tables and a play area right across the street, which was nice as well. The only problem we had was with the wireless internet connection in the room. It kept dropping out every few minutes which made prolonged internet surfing pretty impossible. Not a big deal if you're there for a vacation, more of a problem if you need to work. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, views, pool and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: SunnySanDiego08
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed at the hotel last week. We had a marina view room. Room was very clean and comfortable. Shower was huge and all done up in granite. Gorgeous. The view was amazing. The grounds are spectacular, the pool is very large and heated. The Blue Wave restaurant is very affordable and offers breakfast, lunch and dinner. You can sit outside as well. Staff is very friendly. The hotel allows you to park your car for free, gives you complimentary bicycles to ride across the street along the water. Also across the street is a walking path where you'll find folks jogging, walking or having a picnic lunch. Hotel is accessible to everywhere. Fresh baked cookies are in the lobby every day for you as well as free internet access. I've looked around everywhere and I couldn't have picked a better hotel. A very happy customer from Connecticut.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Small Resort”
Reviews.Author: Monaco_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff. On one side, the Shelter Island marina, on the other, the San Diego bay. Double room are small but clean. You may prefer to book with a marina view they 've got the best view, and are quiet. The swimming pool aera is very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: bgrrl
Reviews.Content: Altadena, Ca. I was worried about our recent trip to San Diego as a single mom traveling with my three kids, two of which are teenagers. My worries were quickly put to rest when we saw how spacious our room was (we were in the last building near the construction site-bottom floor). It was clean, quiet and we felt safe and secure. The location is one of the most picturesque we have stayed at. The staff were upbeat and helpful. It was also nice to have the smaller pool near our room. The only downside is that there' s no breakfast included , there were no screens on the windows by the kitchenette, and finding a spot to park on Saturday night when was an exercise in patience. We had stayed, a few years ago, at a cheaper hotel by the freeway by the big nudie bar which was just gross!!--This hotel, however, was well worth the money we paid per night ($199) --you would probably pay a lot more at the adjacent higher end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Darrkman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in April. I will agree with many of the posts when they say that the staff is friendly. While there I will say that the staff is a great hotel staff and the establishment is very lucky to have them. With that being said I have to say that this hotel is not worth the money that it charges. Now you could say you're paying for the view since it is across the street from the Bay. I won't say you're paying for the area because the neighborhood isn't really close to anything. Its a good area but a bit of a distance from the Downtown San Diego area. To me the hotel should charge $100 - $120 a night for they type of room you get.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and its people”
Reviews.Author: ButchBellingham_WA
Reviews.Content: We recently had the great good fortune to stay at this wonderful hotel during our daughter's wedding week. What a pleasure. We had a two room suite with kitchen that overlooked the channel connecting the harbor to the ocean. A great view with cruise ships and military ships passing by your room. The hotel is straight out of 1960/1970 Hawaiian vintage...clean, bright accomodations with everything you need for a perfect stay. You drive off Rosecrans to Shelter Island and you are automatically in a different zone. What a perfect place. But here's the real gem. As nice as the hotel is, you will not believe the friendliness and courtesy of the staff. Whatever the management is doing here, it is working. From the front desk staff, to the restaurant staff, to the housekeeping staff, to the maintenance crew...this place is possibly the friendliest property we have ever had the pleasure to visit. And don't forget to visit the restaurant while you are there. The food is drop dead great...one of the best hamburgers I've ever had...a great crab cake with big lumps of crab and a breakfast menu to delight any traveler. This will be our "home away from home" whenever we visit San Diego. Our thanks to manager Bill Orman and his crew at the Palms...Evan, Danny, Steph, Shilo, Richard who manages the restaurant and a special thanks to Brianna Bennett who worked with my wife to deliver a wonderful, spectacular breakfast for 60 plus people the day after our daughter's wedding. You people are great. Thank you! Carl and Mary Ann Olsen Washington State

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but over-priced”
Reviews.Author: skip53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and the staff are very friendly, but I thought the price was too high for what you got. To me, this hotel is just a tad above a Howard Johnson or Days Inn, where we could have received a continental breakfast each day and saved $150 per night. We were lucky in that we got the Entertainment Book rate of $109 per night, but normally the rooms are well over $200. Our room was very small for a family of four, but did the job. I think they must have different sized rooms because some of the reviews talk about how spacious the rooms are, with beautiful views. I was told we had a view over the phone, but in reality our view was partial. The reason we chose this hotel over the Howard Johnson or Days Inn was because the reviews on trip advisor of those hotels were that they were in a terrible, unsafe neighborhood, only to find out they were within a mile of this hotel. The Best Western is in a more secluded, beautiful area but we are from Los Angeles, so to us, those other hotels were not in as sketchy of a neighborhood as was described. Yes, there are some strip clubs, but right next store are clean, brand-new shopping centers with a Walgreens or Jack in the Box in them. It's not like you are in some dark, unlit, off-the-beaten path street. Those hotels are on a major boulevard, are well-lit and would have been sufficient for us. So it depends on what you are looking for. We basically just needed a place to sleep since we were out sight-seeing all day. The nice things about the Best Western Island Palms was that it was tranquil and quiet, not on a major street, room service (especially having coffee delivered in the morning!) and the refrigerator in our room. I was able to bring along cereal and keep the milk cold in the fridge so that we didn't have to spend money on breakfast. Overall, a nice place to stay, but overpriced for what you get. If you care about granite counter tops in the bathroom and things like room service, this is for you. If you just need a place to sleep at night, it's not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CathyWolf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Island Palms Hotel the night before leaving on a cruise from San Diego and we had the worst night of sleep because of the noise. First they were re-paving the street in front (we were on the bayside, not the marina side), but that vibration quit about 5:00, so then there was one helicopter after another leaving the nearby navy base including some HUGE plane that woke us up about 1:00 a.m.. We were also at the end of the hallway near an exit door which was opening and closing all night. Other than the noise, the hotel was nice, we were in the Casa Del Mar building which is newer, the room was nice and clean, the bed was comfortable. The car was right outside the patio door (the room had a front door and a patio door). When we originally checked in, they put us in the wrong type of room (the older building), so we had to go back, and they were very accommodating in making the change. The restaurant and bar and pool are are very nice and the yacht harbor behind makes for a nice area to sit near. All employees were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palms Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: slbccm
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 3 days during our Spring Break. Upon check-in, we were told we had been upgraded to a Suite! Corner suite with separate 2 queen bedroom, huge master bath, living area, kitchen and private patio. Wall to wall windows across the entire back of the suite covered with large plantation shutters overlooking the yacht marina. From our private deck/patio we had a view of the bay across the street from the hotel. Very clean, quiet. Grounds are impeccably groomed. Did not use pool as it was a little too cool. However, the pool area was nice - plenty of chairs and nice jacuzzi. We did not have an opportunity to dine at the restaurant so, I cannot comment on that. Situated on Shelter Island which is a great location. Easy to find and very little traffic. Nice walking/running/biking path across the street from hotel which runs parallel to the bay. Beautiful sculptures, nice little playground and a fishing pier. Parking was plentiful and free. Wish we had more than 3 days to enjoy our stay. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Island Palms for ultimate customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_Sacto
Reviews.Content: We had a week long meeting for 35 people at the Island Palms Hotel and Marina. It was a great experience. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Our meeting room had a nice view of the marina and their food was outstanding. Our group had a catered lunch which was wonderful and we had an evening social which was very nice. One night we had a function at a local restaurant and the hotel even provided us transportation. The sleeping rooms were nice and clean and our overall stay was great. The Island Palms is located on Shelter Island which is out of the downtown hustle bustle but has a wonderful view of downtown San Diego and a great place to vacation or hold a meeting. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: jwoge
Reviews.Content: We needed a room for two nights prior to our cruise and choose the BW Island Palms on Shelter Island. SI is a little out of the way (not close to attractions/restaurants) but we had a car so it wasn't a problem. Our room was older and tucked into the corner but was clean and had a fantastically remodeled bathroom. Folks, we are talking heated floors! We had fun feeding the ducks (two of them were ready to enter our room), strolling along the marina and having a drink in the bar. We try to avoid hotel restaurants so I cannot comment on the food service but I will say we saw many folks dining there and they all seemed very happy. (Now I wish we had given it a try). The hotel has a great heated pool. The grounds are lovely; it is a very tropical setting which takes you far away to the islands. I cannot say nice enough things about the staff. The were very friendly and helpful with suggestions, getting us info/mapquests, etc. We used their shuttle service to the ship which saved us time/money. This is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Most Fabulous weekend getaway!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Catra
Reviews.Content: I have been a AAA member all of my life, as is my mom. When I told her I was looking for a great hotel to celebrate my anniversary at, she suggested a hotel that she noticed in the AAA book. I called the hotel direct, and made a reservation for a King Room on the Marina side. Upon our arrival we were greeted by a very friendly bell boy who offered to escort us with our luggage to our room after we checked in. The staff at the front desk was equally as friendly and even had fresh made cookies available as we were checking in. :) My husband and I had our luggage taken to our room while we enjoyed martini's at the bar and a gorgeous point loma sunset. We also had a great experience with the the restaurant. The dining room was beautiful and our server was chipper and very attentive. I had the shrimp scampi, crab bisque, and bread that is shaped in the form of lobster claws. All three were so delicious!! The sparkly lights from the boats and the homes on the hill made me feel like I was truly on vacation. In our room, the bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was very elegant with a granite counter and shower, and appeared to be very new. I especially enjoyed how the hotel was not located on a busy street, but rather tucked away on it's own little peninsula. We stopped by the bar in the morning for Bloody Mary's and sat on the restaurant's patio before heading to lunch at Point Loma's Seafood. P.S. Try the squid sandwich! Every aspect of our stay was amazing and we can't wait to go back again!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjtcan
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the best western was great and true to the reviews we had read before booking. The hotel was clean and the front counter staff were very helpful and polite. We stayed on the second floor of the marina side which is quiet and the room was clean and nice. The bed was very comfortable. Shelter Island was close to all tourist areas such as Old Town, Downtown, SeaWorld etc. If we were to go again (we hope) this would be our first choice of places to stay. We would try the harbor side second floor for the view of the sailboats, cruise ships leaving port. Great hotel and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great business and vacation travel hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aflane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Island Palms last month while on a business trip. What a neat place to conduct business!! On one side of the hotel, you face the marina, and on the other you face the bay. I was bayside, and truly enjoyed watching the larger ships come and go. Checking in was a breeze. Very friendly and attentive front desk staff. But be forewarned, this is a fairly big, sprawling complex. My room was waaaay down towards the end of the compound. At first, I wasn't pleased with the prospect of hiking back and forth to the main building with a laden down briefcase for my meetings, but then I found that my meetings were going to be held in the same building as my sleeping room. They had us preorder lunch every morning, and then served it in the same building as the meeting room. What convenience! The sleeping rooms were fairly standard, except that most had patios or balconies (hence making it convenient to watch the ships). Clean and well appointed with mini-fridges. Free wi-fi internet in the sleeping and meeting rooms. The restaurant in the main building is lovely, and the food is quite good. The exercise room is a little small, but if only one or two people are using it, it's not that claustrophobic. More than two people at a time would be a nightmare. The hotel offers a free airport shuttle. In addition, schedule permitting, the driver will take you to local restaurants and stores. You can then call for pick-up. I wish I had a rental car though, since during my stay it was very chilly, windy and rainy... waiting in the cold for the driver was not pleasant (although the driver WAS pleasant). All in all, I'd go back there again in a heartbeat. My clients loved the place and all I heard were rave reviews. I've recommended the hotel to my business associates. We'll go there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: chicago_girl6
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Best Western Island Palms hotel for a family vacation where we had 3 rooms, two of which we had small children in. We did a lot of research on hotels and this hotel had the most positive reviews and the best price so we went with it and could not have been more pleased with our stay. All of the staff including the front desk, housekeeping, and servers in the restaurant were incredibly friendly. The rooms were very clean, the beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were some of the nicest hotel bathrooms I have seen. The views from the hotel are gorgeous - the marina is on one side and the other side looks out the bay and downtown San Diego. The location is great for sightseeing - we were easily able to get to the San Diego Zoo, Sea World, Coronado Island, Old Town, and La Jolla. It has a great central location for people wanting to see a lot of the touristy attractions. We would definitely stay here again if we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay...”
Reviews.Author: jewelsmum
Reviews.Content: I chose the Island Palms based on previous reviews and was not disappointed. The location is beautiful w/the marina on one side and a bay with fishing pier, grassy area and walking path on the other. My family enjoyed watching the cruise ships and naval vessels come and go. The hotel was easy to find, had lots of free parking and the location was very quiet but easy access to every thing we wanted to do and see in San Diego. The staff were very friendly and offered suggestions on activities and dining, the pool area was beautiful and had a nice clean change room and lots of towels and deck chairs. The rooms are a bit small, but nicely furnished and the bathrooms looked to be recently renovated w/granite counters and shower. We liked the beachy-cottage feel and had a main floor room which featured a gated patio with a table and chairs. The room-service breakfast was a steal at about $8/person and was always delivered on time and hot. After an exhausting day at Sea World we arrived at the restaurant looking less than stellar (I'm surprised they let us in!) and received the most amazing service from Eriq. The food was great too. A couple of minor issues, our phone had no cord and it took several visits to the front desk to get that fixed. The room carpet was a bit grubby and stained but no worse than most, and the beds featured the fattest and most un-yielding (is that even a word?) pillows I've ever used. We requested others but never received them. We enjoyed the hotel, would stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location at a price”
Reviews.Author: Turnhill
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our visit to San Diego. This is a quite location on Shelter Island. Surrounded by boats on one side and a view of the bay on the other, however, there isn't much else to do here without driving. Downtown was around 15 minutes drive. Our rooms were much smaller than expected and motel style with external access. Size would be OK for a couple but a bit cramped for a bigger group as we were. Not especially good value, probably due to exclusive location. Hotel lobby was impressive with nice pool area. We ate at the hotel restaurant which was good but again, a bit expensive. Local town has loads of fast food and restaurants as an alternative. Free cycles available from reception was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Hats Off to Island Palms!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoFlann
Reviews.Content: Fire victims flocked to this paradise with pets in tow. Officially, I believe, pets are not allowed but for us they had a don't ask/don't tell policy. Wonderful room w/ 2 beds and full patio with gate and furniture made us (and Fido) feel at home. Fabulous breakfast in bar with flat screen tv's let us watch fire news. Wonderful, friendly staff made me want to vacation there - in my own home town. GREAT location on Shelter Island with water views of the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: bootsobrien
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days at the begining of October between stays at Palm Springs and Vegas. We had a Jnr Suite with a Bay view. The room itself was lovely and bright with a small kitchen area and seperate living area. It had an outside balcony however it was on the side of the room and the view was blocked by some trees. The room was very clean and the beds comfortable. There seemed plenty of parking. Did not use pool but it looked inviting. The situation of the hotel is its main attraction. It is beautiful with the marina on one side and the bay on the other, very peaceful. We had no problems checking in or out and received great service from the staff. Ordered breakfast to be delivered to the room and it arrived on time and was delicious - not bad value either. Really enjoyed our stay in San Diego and will come back soon. Will we stay here again?yes but would watch the price as I do think it is slightly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for!”
Reviews.Author: AmazonBeagle
Reviews.Content: I had done a lot of research before booking at this hotel. I am so glad that I followed my gut instinct and chose the Island Palms. It is located on Shelter Island which is a very charming area. The boats parked on the harbor as well as at the boat sales stores where really cool to look at. We booked just a standard 2 queen bed room with a bay view and it was wonderful. We had a large patio with a table and chairs (we lucked out and got an end unit). The view of the bay was beautiful and we didn't even pay a premium for it! We explored the other side of the hotel which has the Marina view and that was beautiful as well. The room was very clean and updated. The bathroom had gorgeous granite countertops and natural stone tiles. Parking was very convenient. The location of the hotel is great also and is so close to all of the areas attractions. We have a toddler and he felt very comfortable and loved playing with the pretty Mexican pebbles they had in the planters. I highly recommend this hotel if you want a resort type, waterfront hotel without paying an arm and a leg. I seemed to have gotten the best rate by calling the hotel directly and using my AAA discount. Thank you Tripadvisor for such an excellent service! I used it to find this hotel as well as research all of the activities we did in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Markter
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a wonderful experience this past week. Check in was perfect. We arrived 5 hours early and there was no line, but the front desk was fully staffed. Took all of 5 minutes to get checked in and our room was already ready! We stayed in the nice two-story Casa Del Mar Villa by the marina. The place was very comfortable and had all the amenities we could want. The beds were so comfortable, it was better than home! Everything was so well done, staff was prompt and friendly, the area and view were just what we needed. Checkout was just as quick and easy and they even follow up by email before and after your stay. This was our best vacation yet and the San Diego Island Palms played a big part in making it so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Best Western”
Reviews.Author: JPinMonument
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 was just wrapping up a lovely week long vacation in San Diego, when our Delta representative told us that our return flight had been canceled and that they would put us up for another night. When he told me that we would be staying at a Best Western I got a little concerned. My previous experiences were lower class, bad areas and not that clean. This hotel was excellent.! We were given a King Suite which had a large bedroom with a king size bed and a large front room with a queen size sofa couch and a small kitchen. The pool was nice with the hotel providing a large assortment of inflatable and dive toys for the kids. The hotel also provides guests with complementary bikes for a family ride along the shoreline. This is a perfect hotel for a family with small children. If we every take another vacation in San Diego we will stay at the Island Palms. John Monument, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “loved the view”
Reviews.Author: Irish815
Reviews.Content: Very Pleasant experience, great view and great restaurant. However, the rooms are not air conditioned, except for the bedroom. We stayed in a one bedroom suite and it was hotter than Haiti. We found it colder in the lobby. We ended up opening the windows because it was cooler outside than it was inside. Also, there were a lot of remains from dead birds around, i.e. feathers etc. Otherwise a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sweetsyn
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at Island Palms from July 11 - 15. We stayed in a Casa Del Mar King Suite which was very spacious for all of us. It had a king bed with a TV in one room and a sofa pull-out sleeper in a seperate room with another TV. We had a kitchenette with a sink, mini fridge, and microwave. That was perfect for storing snacks, cereal, popcorn, etc. Our room had a balcony facing the bay with a view of the street as well. Though others said they felt the side with the boats was nicer, we really enjoyed our view, especially at night. We could also see downtown lit up at night and it was nice to see open water without tons of boats in the way. It is very close to all of the San Diego attractions. The main pool is nice and they even have an outdoor poolside bar. The pool stays open until 11pm every night which was nice to dive into after a long day of walking at various parks, etc. We go locked out of room several times in one day. For whatever reason the key stopped working. The maintenance man had to be called several times to let us back in and we had to go to the front desk to get a new key each time. That was very irritating, especially since it's quite a hike to the front desk from the Casa Del Mar building. I complained about it at checkout and we were given half off of our stay. The management was very appologetic and seemed very sincere. We'd definitely stay here again during our next visit to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: AimeeB89
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 (me, husband, daughter, mother and mother in law) stayed at this property from July 8th through the 14th. We were able to reserve a queen suite for half price using the entertainment member discount. We paid $189 a night plus tax. The queen suite had a seperate bedroom with two queen beds and a TV, a living room with a fold out couch, another TV and 2 chairs and kitchen with a bar and 4 chairs and a stove and a microwave but no oven. We actually added a rollaway bed which we got for free and tucked in between the beds in the bedroom for my daughter to sleep on. The bathroom was beautiful and rather large. It had a glass walk in shower and a double sink however it was a little difficult trying to get my 2 year old a bath in the shower but we managed. Our room over looked the marina side note: make sure and request the marina side when booking it was so neat to see all of the yachts coming in and out, if you over look the bay side you are overlooking the street and then the bay definetely not as pretty. I would stay at this hotel again on our next San Diego visit it was clean and comfortable and the staff was awesome and so willing to help you in any way. They could update the furniture and bed spreads and it would be that much nicer. It was really close to Sea World and the Zoo and downtown San Diego. I miss this place already!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place for families or mini-reunions”
Reviews.Author: dorkozak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel June 21-24 in the 2-story villas with a group of 7 adults (30's) as a mini college reunion. Got a great rate, cheaper than renting 3 separate rooms at other hotels. Have to say, furniture, etc not that fancy (hey, it's a Best Western), but the view out our patio was fabulous! Totally quiet, margaritas at sunset (which we could make in our small kitchen - FYI: no oven, just a stove/microwave), and lots of relaxation. This is a great place we all agreed if you have kids (easy, lots of stuff to do, free bike rentals, good amount of space) and was great for us, as it allowed lots of down time to just sit and watch the boats. One caveat - this is not a true "resort" with super fancy accomodations. Our rooms were not made up every day (we asked after day one, however, and the staff were very accomodating) but what a great value for the $. Shelter Island is right across the bay looking at San Diego, and it really added to the vacation getaway feel, while keeping a convenient location to Gaslight, etc. Our friends liked the free shuttle service to the airport, and we all agreed that we really relaxed because of the location. Two hints I got from fellow trip advisors: 1) have dinner at Bali Hai at sunset/night - wow, what a view! and 2) get a room facing the boats (back of the hotel; not San Diego Harbor) as it's much quieter and serene. Overall a nice, no muss, no fuss, vacation with lots of quality time and opportunities to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to come back to while being a tourist.”
Reviews.Author: Sgold65420
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through their central reservation service who books several hotels in the area. The Travel Agent listened to my needs and selected this hotel for me. We needed a "rack" to stay in while taking our two kids to Sea World, and the zoo. We enjoyed our stay. Is very convenient to Sea World, and San Diego in general. The front desk staff is very helpful and courteous. They have printed directions and maps to all travel sites. It is not fancy or elegant, but iis clean and quiet. It is not a resort in which to spend the whole day. It is a comfortable, well located hotel to come back to after a busy day as a tourist. We stayed in the new building, which was immaculate. Our room was huge, and had a kitchenette. Obviously, there are many choices in San Diego. This was a nice alternative to the high rise properties and the exclusive resorts. I would recommend a stay there if this is what you need. It certainly met our needs and exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: maett
Reviews.Content: Four friends and I stayed at the Island Palms from April 27 th to May 4th and had a wonderful stay. We stayed in the new Del Mar building in a villa and it was beautiful with up and downstairs. Two bedrooms with king beds up and a pullout couch downstairs. Three bathrooms, tv in every bedroom and the living room, full kitchen. and there is also a safe. We were located across from the pool, with a beautiful view of the marina. The staff were all professional and helpful and we found housekeeping to be verygood, the room was always clean and fresh. Shelter Island is centrally located and close to all San Diego attractions. My friends and I loved this hotel and hope to return sometime in the future, and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Island Palms”
Reviews.Author: HeyJude1210
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Island Palms on the nights of March 25 & 26, 2007, in room 526. It was a beautiful, spacious, tropical feeling room and we loved it. It overlooked the marina, which was lovely. It had a mini-kitchen, two small fridges, large, spacious bathroom and dressing room area. The staff was very friendly. Room service prices were very reasonable (we ordered breakfast...very good). Price of the room was about $180 a night. One drawback was that after shopping and playing til late afternoon, we returned to the room and it was not yet made up. However, I am sure that if we had called them, someone would have been sent right up. The housecleaning staff was still in the hallway, so we gave them the old towels and took the clean towels and we were ok with that. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but the housekeeping...”
Reviews.Author: tellitlikeitis2
Reviews.Content: We stayed there three nights during the spring break. It's located in Shelter Island, kind of away from all the busy stuff but close and easy enough to get to it. You have the marina view on one side and city view on the other. The Island is not crowded by any means and it's a very relaxing setting. We love the location. The staff of the hotel was nice and we really enjoyed everything about the hotel, except its housekeeping, which was horrible. We checked into the hotel and quickly found out that although the room was cleaned, it was used by the late check out guests. We found trash on the floor, in the trash can, used shower, half empty toiletry, etc. Not good. Although one phone call to the fornt desk and it was taken care of. No big deal (or I thought). Second day, we left a nice tip and a note asking for extra coffee mugs. When we returned, tip and note were gone and no coffee mug. I also noticed the shampoo bottle the maids left on the counter for us was half empty. Used? I wondered. We called the front desk before we stepped out to the pool and was promised it would be taken care of. An hour later upon our return, nothing! Second call to the front desk, they were not sure why it was not taken care of yet. The maid did come by right after that. Third day, noticed the tub was dirty upon our return. Finally had it and went to the front desk. I asked the staff if the hotel does a full clean daily. He replied yes! So I gave him the run-down and he said that they did make the bed,etc but would not clean the tub unless we specifically asked them to. Now that wasn't a full clean, was it? I felt my complaint went nowhere really. He told me he would definitely make a note of it. I don't think it was just bad luck to have problems with housekeeping three days in a row though. Set the housekeeping problems aside, I will probably stay there again for what the hotel has to offer, i.e. location, views, friendly staff. However, if I do run into the same problem with its cleaness again, then it will be a big no-no for me.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ARLynn
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this property. Located on Shelter Island, this is just a few minutes to all local attractions. The grounds are well maintained. Has outside heated pool and hot tub. Marina to one side of property and bay view on other. Nice area to just walk around with the family and view sailboats and downtown SanDiego. THe restaurant is a great place to eat breakfast with food and service both excellent. Only drawback for some may be that this is an older property. Although beautiful updates have been made, rooms are a bit on the small side and still has no central heat or air in some rooms. The unit in the room works well and rooms are nicely decorated and very clean. Also have some nice lighting touches. We have gotten a marina view room on both stays and had a sitting area outside the room with chairs/table.Great place to just relax .

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad !”
Reviews.Author: jetlagnow
Reviews.Content: This wasn't too bad. I've stayed at most of the hotels on Shelter Island and this one is better than average. I've stayed twice recently. Once in the Casa Del Mar building and once in one of the tropical themed little huts that jut out from the other buildings. I preferred the layout of the rooms in the Casa del Mar building because they were quiet (better insulation) and also more spacious than the other "tropical" themed building. Overall the rooms were very clean and the staff were very friendly and accomodating (both times). The room service was reasonably priced (not a complete rip off like most hotels) and was a good value with tasty food (good waffles!). Drawbacks were that the room in the Casa del Mar building needed work in the bathroom (needing grouting to be redone and the wallpaper had started to peel). The "tropical" themed other building (hut) was great (had a nice little porch area that was relaxing to enjoy the breeze). BUT it was very noisy (almost no insulation between the room and the next room). It was also more cramped than the other room, as they made the bathroom too large (weird layout) yet without a bath tub! But other than that I would rate this hotel fairly well. I would give it a B+ for the Shelter Island area. Would recommend for tourists and locals alike. Would not recommend for noisy families with kids or for partiers. The location is great and the decor is pretty good. Price is about right for what you get. This is a good middle-of-the-road comfortable hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 1000placestogo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights. I booked a suite for my family of 5. The suite was large, clean and tastefully decorated. The view from our private balcony was lovely. We enjoyed the clean pool and breakfast (not included) at the restaurant. I almost cancelled this hotel based on some of the posted reviews -I am so glad I didn't. I most worried about a recent inquiry from a Mom who asked if it was a good selection for a family. A local responded it "was just OK". I have to disagree! The atmosphere is tropical resort, the furnishings are lovely, the location is super handy to everything in San Diego -I only wish we had planned to stay longer. I am already planning our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Dark, Dreary Rooms”
Reviews.Author: golfette
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel & basically agree with them - the location is absolutely great and the hotel staff are really pleasant and accommodating. HOWEVER, and this is a big however, if you don't like dark, dreary, musty smelling outdated rooms, I would not stay at the Island Palms part of this hotel. One building, the Casa Del Mar building of the hotel, appeared to be newer & was probably updated. We had never been at this hotel before so we didn't know this beforehand. We booked a water view junior suite in the Casa Del Mar building, but the hotel "upgraded" us to a full suite on the water since they apparently gave our room to someone else. The suite idea was nice, the location was great, but the suite was terribly old, brown (yes brown! - everything in it was brown) and dark. The curtains were those old filmy kind which were half off the rods, and covered by dark brown drapes which were also half off the rods. The cabinet in the bedroom which held the TV had to be from the 50's when this hotel was 1st built, with large chips of wood missing. There was only one lamp with a single 100 watt bulb in the whole bedroom area. We paid $243 per nite, plus San Diego City 10% tax for this room, which I think was way too much considering the condition of the room. This suite actually rents for $299 a nite, but since they "upgraded" us from the $258 Jr. Suite rate, they gave it to us for the above (which also included the 10% AAA discount). I wouldn't be complaining if we got it for 50% off rack rate as one of the reviewers paid, but for the amount we were charged it was way overpriced. It's a shame as the staff is great, the location is lovely, the pool area is very nice and the restaurant is attractive - if only you didn't have to stay in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: amsmomma
Reviews.Content: Booked using the entertainment card rate...50% off rack rate which was a great deal. Loved the atmosphere. Our room faced the marina and it was fun watching the boats. On the other side of the hotel, across the street, was a beautiful view of downtown San Diego. There was also a fishing pier and a small beach area where our kids looked for sea shells. The front desk staff were all very friendly. We were offered directions and a map to all of the attractions upon check in. The room was immaculately clean. The bathroom was very nice with an enclosed glass shower and beautiful countertops. We were in a one story building and it felt like we were staying in a little cottage by the marina. The area had a small town feel..almost like staying on our own little island. Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: bengaluv
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to say, I booked my room using an Entertainment book (---) and received 50% off my room. Maybe it wouldn't have been worth paying "full price," but the room was fabulous for half price. The Best Western Island Palms is in the process of renovating their rooms. I stayed in one that had obviously been renovated already. It was beautiful. I stayed in a King size marina view room. It was lovely waking up and sitting outside on the patio with a cup of coffee looking at the yachts. The hotel staff is friendly and pleasant, and they were more than happy to provide concierge service. The bartender was charming. The restaurant served up a fabulous breakfast. The room was cleaned impeccably every day. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and views.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugbc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Island Palms over New Years, after spending Christmas in Las Vegas and driving to Los Angeles and then San Diego. The staff at check in, and on checking out were friendly and courteous. The room faced the parking lot (next time I would book one that faces the marina). The room was clean and the housekeepers were excellent. Having a fridge in the room was an added bonus. The location is great. Shelter Island is beautiful and the walkway just steps from the hotel was great for going for strolls. Watching the boats at the boat launch and the sea lions harrasing the returning fisherman was entertaining. We did not eat in the restaurant, but, it and the bar looked appealing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and will definitely stay there again on future trips to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the location”
Reviews.Author: nmnative
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to San Diego the Friday before Thanksgiving for a mini-vacation before driving to meet the rest of the family in Phoenix. We booked one night at this hotel because all others were full. I had been to Shelter Island many times and had explored the grounds of this hotel so I knew what to expect. There is nothing more beautiful than the views in San Diego. Shelter Island is no exception. I love that you can walk/run along the water on the path. People are out there all day long. I could sit and watch the sailboats for hours. The hotel is not very nice. The lobby and restaurant are well kept. The food is decent. The pool and jacuzzi are nice. The jacuzzi is kept very hot and clean towels are available out there. The rooms on the other hand are very smalll and dirty. I didn't like that the fridge is in the bathroom. Our toilet ran all night. The tv didn't work very well and we never felt safe having the parking lot right out our front door. They overcharge if you ask me. The rooms in the back facing the marina are definitely a better deal if you can afford them. We looked at this hotel as a one night stopover before getting to our resort destination. The staff was friendly though. Oh, and like one person said, the beds are dirty. They are lumpy and old and the bedspreads need washing or updating...please. Would I stay here again, no. Did it serve its purpose, yes. I guess it is just a matter of what you are use to and what your taste is.

Reviews.Title: “Scenic views on the island”
Reviews.Author: soundbit
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in mid-October. We had a room in the older section and it was okay. Room was clean and quiet even though it faced the bay and parking area. There were 2 small negatives - the carpet had been shampooed earlier and was not quite dry when we checked in. The other was that the bathroom's water supply was extremely hot. If not careful, one could get scalded easily, especially a child. We did not use the pool or restaurant. We asked for a power strip in order to plug in an appliance near the nightstand but they did not have any. I had to unplug a lamp in order to use the appliance.

Reviews.Title: “Chilled out!”
Reviews.Author: wee1
Reviews.Content: A bit of backgound first .... My husband (31) and I (30), stayed here for 5 nights near the end our 3 week trip down the Californian coast. We wanted somewhere to chill out and do absolutely nothing after a very busy tour. It was our relaxing part of the trip. All we wanted was somewhere clean with a bar/restaurant, a pool and in an area where it was pleasant to go for a stroll. I booked an Island Palms Marina view King direct with the hotel a few months beforehand and paid $161 a night before tax. I had e-mailed the hotel a few times with various questions and queries and they always responded quickly. The only thing we had planned was a day at SeaWorld (which we loved, I'd recommend the 'Behind the Scenes' tour - I think we paid about $11 each online, definitely worth it!) When we arrived at the airport I called the hotel for the FREE shuttle which arrived in about 10 minutes, very prompt. The shuttle was one of the big positives of the hotel. The 2 drivers went out of their way to give recommendations, advice and help. Nothing was too much for them! They gave us a card and told us to call anytime if we needed taking anywhere or picking up from anywhere. We took them up on this on 2 occassions and they took us to SeaWorld and picked us up from Old Town on the 2 days we ventured out. I must admit that I was a bit dissapointed in the room initially. It didn't look like the website pictures and was quite dated and shabby with a very old, stained carpet. However, it was clean and comfortable. We had a flickering light and phoned reception who sent someone to fix it straight away. We were in the Sunset Garden area which was used for 2 weddings during our stay. It didn't inconvienience us at all, but we were given vouchers for a complimentary drink at the bar and offered a later checkout time as one wedding was on the day of our departure. There is a resident flock of ducks which waddle around the gardens. Very cute, but not when they're quacking at 7a.m. - bring earplugs! I have read other reviews where people have complained about the standard of housekeeping. We had no problems on that front but did notice several room service trays left outside rooms for up to 24 hours without being cleared away. I also had a wierd experience when a non-english speaking housekeeping woman knocked on the door, gave me a very odd freaky smile and walked away. We ate at the restaurant one night and the bar 2 nights. No complaints there. Yes, the restaurant service was a bit slow by American standards, but OK by British standards! The staff were all very friendly and we had a few jolly nights in the bar! On the recommendation of one of the shuttle drivers we booked a table at the Hawaiian themed Bali Hai restaurant at the other end of the island. It was about a 10/15 minute walk. If you can, make your booking to co-incide with sunset. It's spectacular to see the the tall glass buildings across the bay sparkle in the red sunlight. It's not cheap, but the service was very good, the food was lovely, and definitely try out the cocktails! They're fab! This was one of my favourite nights. We also ate at the Fiddlers Green restaurant about a 20minute walk away. My husband said his steak was the best he'd ever had. High praise indeed! The days we weren't at SeaWorld or wondering around Old Town (who needs to go to Mexico -it's here!) and Downtown, we lazed by the pool. There are 2 pools and the one by the reception and bar area was always busy. The smaller pool in the Casa Del Mar area was much quieter, in fact, most of the time we had the pool area and whirlpool to ourselves. There were supposed to be towels provided, but on 2 occassions I had to go to the other pool to get them as there were none. So, in conclusion .... Good points: free shuttle, helpful staff, great bar, free internet access, 2 pools, lovely views, peaceful location. Bad points: housekeeping, shabby room, pool towels, noisy ducks!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Island Palms”
Reviews.Author: BBontheMove
Reviews.Content: My best friend, our daughters (12 and 17) and I stayed at the Island Palms on September 15, 2006. I booked a double room since there were four of us staying, but upon arrival the very friendly receptionst informed me we had been upgraded. The room had 2 queen beds and was a suite complete w/ kitchenette and veranda. The suite was pretty, new, had new furniture, was very large and comfortable. All of that worked well with 4 females in 1 room!. The decor was a "islandy" type and the location was marvelous - we had a partial view of the ocean. The marina was great - all sorts of yachts and boats and homes speckled along the inlet. The only meal we ate at the hotel was breakfast. Each of us had something different (french toast, pancakes, omelet, Belgium waffle, potatoes, bacon, fresh fruit, juice coffee) and all were delicious! We had dinner elsewhere - I enquired about a good place to go and have dinner when we checked in. The receptionist recommended a very good resturant and gave us a coupon for discounts on the meals for a couple of places. But given how pleased we were with breakfast, I would try dinner there next time. There was only 1 drawback - the new addition to the hotel has no elevator and if you are located on the 2nd floor- you will have to drag your luggage up about 15 steps. The receptionist asked if being on the 2nd floor was a problem and I said, "no". I would stay there again in a minute and plan to. We enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “NO NO NO”
Reviews.Author: sweetjuly
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location: Shelter Island is a very quiet and safe area of San Diego from where you can easily get everywhere you like. As for the rest the Shelter Island was a big let down for us. We booked an Island Palms room trough expedia at a very good rate. Upon arrival we were given room 117 (stay away from it). The room size was ok, but it looked dated, gloomy and not very clean ( the blanked looked so old and ragged I didn't feel comfortable touching it). During the night I couldn't sleep because the room is located right in front of the ice machine and the walkway outside the room made a rattling noise every time someone passed by with the luggage. So the next morning I complained to the front desk and without an apology they offered us an upgrade to a room facing the marina for 30$ plus tax a night. We accepted, but though more silent, the room looked exactly like the first one: gloomy and not very clean. The following day we left the Hotel at 10.30 a.m. and returned at 8.00 p.m. to find our room undone. To make a long story short, we asked three (!!!) times for the room to be done, but no one did it. When we checked out I told them I was very unsatisfied with my stay and they didn't charge us the second night upgrade. For all we went through (not getting enough sleep, packing and un-packing again, untidy room) I don't think it was near enough, but what bothered me the most was the lack of apology and the staff attitude: they dealt with our problems like it was no big deal. My advice: spend your money somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy!”
Reviews.Author: Rren
Reviews.Content: This hotel had to be the worst of anywhere we stayed in our month in California and the most expensive. It was the equivalent price to 2 rooms at San Francisco's sparkling Argonaut Hotel but hardly in the the same class. We paid Â£600 per night so expected something special. That's pounds not dollars! Multiply roughly by 2 and you'll get an idea of how much we were ripped off! We stayed in the Island Palms section in a villa and I agree with previous reviews which say that website pictures are very misleading. That's if you can get it to stop crashing and have to restart your computer every time. The "villa's" are only the equivalent of 4 small motel rooms joined top to bottom by a grotty and slippy spiral staircase. The villa's are right next to the hotel's ballroom which hosts their many weddings and the noise would be a problem if you had small kids or needed to sleep. I rang and asked Reception at what point the disco was finishing and was told that it was virtually over - it went on for another two hours!! The block is basically a sixties motel given a superficial tart up. The windows are still the same grotty metal frames and are impossible to open. The a/c is old fashioned individual units and noisy. The rooms are dark and furnished in a dirty dreary green colour presumably to hide the stains which are over everything, carpets and furnishings included. The main problem however is that EVERYTHING is dirty or broken. The door into our room was filthy and it went on from there. Stained, scuffed, broken or uncared for was the order of the day. The "full kitchen" promised was underequipped, scruffy and smelt permanently of sour milk. NOTHING worked properly from the lights to the tv's and the room was not cleaned well every day we were there, even the bedcushions had unsavoury looking stains. Yuck. Dog poop in the corridor was also a nice touch one day! (upstairs!) Well I think it was dog's.... People let their dogs mess on the grass outside your rooms as well. It is not very private when sitting outside due to the constant foot traffic and the odd strange kid on noisy, petrol driven scooters. There seems to be no restriction on who can walk through the hotel's pathways and gawp at you in the pool. We did not swim as we felt the rooms were so filthy we were likely to catch something in the pool. Security is also a huge problem, we were woken at 3.30 am by someone banging on every door. This was a worry as my teenage daughter was sleeping on her own downstairs. the doors are left permanently propped open and there is no staff in this building overnight nor any security that I saw. Shelter Island sounds nice but is, in reality ,one big car park with weirdo's hanging around all weekend. We also found it hard to park anywhere near the hotel. This was a nasty surprise after 6 hours spent crawling along the 5 at 15 mph all the way from Santa Barbara (no exaggeration) This was in no way worth the money and we all felt that we needed a good wash after leaving! We only did not check out because we could not find anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Decent and quiet motel”
Reviews.Author: karatemomm
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on AAA at $143 a night for two nights August 11 and 12th 2006. Read good reviews here and found it to be one of the cheaper hotels with good reviews. Had read that the hotel restaraunt had slow service, but ate one breakfast there anyway--have to agree sloooow service (pleasant people, but had a long wait and many excuses). Parking is at a premium on weekend evenings--daytime okay. Always got a space, but had to walk or wait in the evening. Called for extra towels-never showed up. Staff was courteous and were pleasant on the phone when we called to verify. Room was upgraded free, from 2 doubles to 2 queens. It was dated, but clean and had a view of the marina. It was quiet, even though the soda machines and ice were right across the hall. Even though there was a road between the hotel and the bay it was still a nice view and the marina is right behind the motel. I would stay here again--close enough to everything, but quiet with a nice view. As far as airplanes--I think no matter where you are in San Diego you will hear them.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Vespertine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Island Palms Hotel & Marina in San Diego 2 nights -- 8/1/06 - 8/3/06. We payed $179.00 per night. I thought it was a rip off. Hotel staff was nice and helpful. We checked into our room and found it was very small and the pictures on the website are VERY midleading. While we did have a view of the marina, there was a street between the hotel and the water. The pictures on the website mislead us to believe the room was bigger and better decorated and that we would be right on the water. For 179.00 a night, you'd think you were getting something pretty nice...we didn't. The rooms are small and medicocre. Also, it's near the airport so we could hear jets and helicopters all the time. Parking was fine the first night but the next night the hotel must have booked up because we had to park in the hotel lot next door which was really far from our room. The area of the hotel is far from the cool sections of san diego but a short drive to SeaWorld. We had a rental car so we were able to drive to the gas lamp district, old town, etc. They have free internet. There was no tub in the bathroom, just a shower. The head board to our bed fell off the wall as we were packing to leave. I called the front desk to let them know and they said it happens all the time (?!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - but not really good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ander12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Best Western Island Palms Hotel in San Diego for 5 nights at the end of July. We payed $279 for a Casa del Mar suite which was larger than the average hotel room, but at this price I felt it was slightly too expensive. Used to large mediterranean Hotels in Europe, offering beautiful pools with plenty of space for deckchairs, the hotel pool was rather disappointing. Despite the high price and rather poor pool aera, the warm welcome we received by every member of staff in this hotel was second to none. Having made contact with the hotel directly to clarify a question at time of reservation, the hotel reservation manager mailed us plenty of brochures about things to do and to see in and around San Diego, which help us to plan and organise our valuable time. The hotel shuttle bus driver kindly provided transport to some of the San Diego attractions thus saving us to wait and pay for a taxi and each and every employee in the restaurant and reception was just very kind, helpful and friendly. The only other downside was the standard of cleanliness of the room and restaurant area. Our room was not vacuum cleaned for the entire period and almost every day we had to ask for a clean cup or glass to replace the one offered to us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: JLIN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 122 for $159 a night. Probably one of the smallest rooms, but all that was available when we arrived. Limited view. It's a very nice place to enjoy the pool or take a walk. The room was a bit dated and small, but it was very quiet even though the ice maker was just outside. A pleasant hotel with a few dining choices nearby. We ate at the hotel next to ours--fair prices and great seafood. I think the way to really take advantage of this hotel is if you traveled in a big group and secured rooms in the same courtyard with a marina view...there are chairs to sit and chat in each section's courtyard...about 15 minutes to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic people, fabulous hotel, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: HOADLYVA
Reviews.Content: My family, 3 generations of us, stayed 2 nights in early June. I called and talked to Dawn, who was the most friendly, professional, and helpful person. My Mom stayed in a marina view room which had a great view of all the boats . At night it is so romantic with the lights, the sound of the water, and that night someone was playing music on their yacht. Their room was close to the pool , which my 6yr old grandson loved swimming in and he really enjoyed looking at all the boats as well. Our room was a bayside suite and it was huge! For 4 people we had plenty of room. Two very comfortable queen beds, a diningroom table and 4 chairs, 2 easy chairs and ottoman, and the sink, microwave and refigerator made eating in great. We ordered room service and they were fantastic. The food was good and the service impecable. When the server found out my mom and are handicapped she offered to go get us ice so we could enjoy our lunch, what a doll! The entire staff made us feel welcomed and right at home. We had a patio which overlooked the bay and we saw naval ships, party boats, sailboats, we all loved it. We can't wait to go back again. We stayed here last Labor Day for 4 nights and had a blast. It's nice to know there is an establishment that is consistently beautiful, a good value, and has a staff as outstanding as the Island Palms. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: AZJandM
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying 3 nights at the Best Western Island Palms Hotel & Marina on Shelter Island in San Diego, CA. We went with our three children - ages 9, 8 and 2. Was it still relaxing - YES! We stayed in the Casa Del Mar Jr. Suite. It had 2 queen size beds, separate kitchen, huge bathroom. Just overall a great size for a family of five. The suite opened up to a balcony that overlooked the marina. It was great seeing that every morning and every night. That's what I mean by relaxing. Even with traveling with three children, having a view like that will make just about anyone relaxed. The staff were great. Very personable and informative. They have two pools and two hot tubs. We liked the bigger of both. In the afternoon, there was complimentary cookies which the kids loved. They also have at the front desk a coupon good for a free appetizer at one of the restaurants right on the island. Very good food and kid friendly. They are famous for their seafood. We thought the hotel was convenient to everywhere we wanted to go and it was not crowded at all. The front of the hotel overlooks the bay which is nice to walk in the evening. Overall, it was wonderful and we would stay there again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Scenic”
Reviews.Author: DollarsMom
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about how noisy the hotels are at Pacific Beach, we looked for something that promised to be more quiet and peaceful. Thanks to the help of the positive reviews this hotel received, we found exactly what we were looking for at the Island Palms. The views of the harbor were lovely, the room was spacious, clean and comfortable, and the staff could not have been nicer. The location was also very convenient to everything in town and we were able to park right next to our room. We will stay here every time we come to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay in this hotel, get a view or the suite if you can afford it. We got the guet room and it is very small. The positive about this hotel is the area. It is right at the bay where you can casually strole with the family or a significant other. The other positive is customer service. It is obvious that customer service is a big priority. Very curteous and prompt. The negative is that the place itself can use some remodeling. My already small room was scratched up in some places and there was areas outside where trash and fleas were abundant. The restaurant was slightly above average but could used more variety. What makes this hotel worth the stay is the area and customer service. Ide give it a B (or 4 out of 5)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: drewsmama
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 chose this hotel based on TA reviews. We were pleasantly surprised on check-in by being upgraded to a suite. It was located in the newer Casa Del Mar building. The suite was large, beautifully appointed and very clean. The building had its own pool and jacuzzi which we used every night. We also had a lovely view of the marina. The hotel is within 10-15 minutes of many local attractions. We highly recommend this gem and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Marina Retreat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with a view of the Marina. We stayed in one of the lower level rooms. The room is very nice, very spacious, giving it a bugalow feel. We have our own private fenced-in patio just outside the door; bamboo and palm trees everywhere. It's very peaceful to sit inside at the table and work. The wooden louvered windows give a nice view from inside the room, and it allows a lot of light inside - really brightens the room. The bathroom is super spacious. The staff is awesome. Nothing but good things to say about this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Views - Nice Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ginkwunk
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - minutes away from San Diego airport - 20 minutes from LaJolla cove - We always stay in the junior suite with 2 queen beds and a pull out couch and kitchen. The suites have a small outdoor sitting area that overlook the marina (stunning view) or the bay. Short drive to Cabrillo Monument - check out their incredible tide pools and sunsets. We have stayed at the Island Palms twice now - can't beat it - good value and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet and clean!!”
Reviews.Author: OhioTrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We booked double bed no view(had a rate at $109 per night AAA). Our philosophy is a room is only to sleep and change in. We like to see and do all we can when on vacation. Room requirement needs to be clean and not feel icky!!! I was pleasantly suprised at the room and loved the large bathroom with a small fridge. Nice suprise perfect for sodas from Vons just up the street!! The hotel was very clean and quiet. Except for the family of ducks and ducklings didn't hear anything. The staff was great and friendly!! So close to everything! If you are looking for lots of extras and pizazz, this hotel isn't for you.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Island Palms Hotel & Marina
HotelInfo.Address: 2051 Shelter Island Drive, San Diego, CA 92106
